Educate technical and non-technical team members on statistics & data science capabilities, methodologies, and practical applications, instilling this mindset into our overarching quality strategy

Propose and develop novel statistical methods to extract meaningful insights from complex data 
Design, implement, test, and deploy end-to-end data solutions, from concept through to discovery, transformation & collection, and on to analysis & reporting. Providing actionable insights across multiple subjects including product health, user behaviour & sentiment, team efficiency & productivity, and data quality 
Build and apply ML models for classification, clustering, prediction, extraction, and factor analysis 
MS/BS in Computer Science/Applied Mathematics/Statistics/Data Science or related fields. 
Experience working with machine learning libraries and real-world data science problems. 
Experience in applied statistics & mathematics skills: p-values, confidence intervals, regression, distributions, sampling, variability. 
Prioritises clean, sustainable, engineering practices 
Skilled in at least one statistics/data science orientated language. (We predominantly use R and Python but are not limited to these) 
Ability to formulate strategies and create clarity from vague and/or ambiguous requirements, while working with incomplete/dirty data. 
Understanding and application of theory and algorithm fundamentals with the ability to utilise advanced knowledge on real world challenges.

A numerical degree with a minimum 2:1 grade or equivalent Over 18 months years of experience in operational research, customer analytics, BI analytics, data science Excellent experience with Excel and SQL. Highly advantageous to have used Python or R as well as cloud computing platforms and big data tools A commercially insightful and results-driven nature An excellent level of consulting communication skills The ability to mentor less experienced members of the team Company pension Monday to Friday Yes

Collaborating with Senior Data Scientist to develop and maintain data models and company-wide dashboards 
Building out team data science capabilities by contributing to reviews and design decisions Comfort with a scripting language (like Python or R) and a relevant data analysis package (e.g. Pandas) and experience with SQL 
Analytical mindset and ability to break down complex ideas into simple pieces 
Experience cleaning, exploring, and drawing insights from complex data pipelines 
Ability to communicate insights to a wide audience, e.g. through data visualisation 
Experience with git and running analyses in the cloud 
Experience running statistical analyses 
Integrity. You have an unwavering commitment to ‘confronting the grey’ in all areas of your work, and encourage transparency in all your interactions. 
Problem-solving. You understand the importance of rigorously detailed data, and have a strong ability to synthesise complex and potentially competing requirements, and convert them into recommendations that drive impact decisions. 
Curiosity. You have a desire to think innovatively and explore and understand how different perspectives and complex data blend together to create the bigger picture and context.
 Learning. You love learning new things, like to share what you learn, and can pick up new tools and methods quickly.
 Grit. You have a hands-on, can-do attitude and have the drive to dig deep into problems to discover pain points and features from multiple perspectives, and resilience to stay focused on a project to the end.
 Passion. If being part of a team that designs and deploys technology for global health sounds exciting, we want to meet you!
 
Social impact. Work with our partners and users to deliver technology that has the potential to impact millions of lives.
 An incredible, diverse team. Ask any “Simprinter” what their favourite thing about working at Simprints is, and the answer is likely to be “the people.” Our work is at the intersection of technology and global development, and we’ve managed to build an amazing team drawn from the best technology companies, iNGOs, UN agencies, and universities around the world.
 Flexible hours. More efficient late at night? Better before the sun rises? That’s fine by us. We are looking for people who get the job done, not for people who work between 9 am and 5 pm. 
Unlimited paid time off. We set high standards and goals, but give people the freedom to choose when and how to recharge. Join a team that trusts you with the job. 
Professional development and wellbeing. We promote continual learning with self-directed learning objectives, external mentors, and regular one-on-one feedback. We also put our money where our mouth is with a dedicated ‘Learning & Wellness’ budget, managed by our Talent and Operations team.

Dive deep into how users use our suite of financial well-being tools through quantitative analysis, data segmentation and marketing attribution Understand user behaviours and long-term trends, identifying new levers to move key metrics and drive KPIs Influence product decisions and product launches through data-based recommendations (e.g. A/B tests) Work with engineers to implement data instrumentation Regularly communicate findings to stakeholders and rest of company 3+ years of experience as a data scientist, preferably in a product environment Excellent SQL skills Technical background and programming experience, especially in Python or R Applied statistical skills, e.g. distributions, statistical testing, regression Experience with anomaly detection and feature generation Experience conducting A/B experiments Experience working with stakeholders to gather requirements and understand needs A strong ability to communicate findings to non-technical stakeholders in a concise and engaging manner We will pay you what you're worth. We are fully committed to closing the gender pay gap, promoting diversity and inclusivity, and paying people what they deserve to be paid. We're a Remote First business - work from home or our London office - you choose! We will help you manage your busy lifestyle with flexible working opportunities, most of the team work "core hours" to allow touchpoints with your team, but we also make sure you have the time to pick the kids up at 3pm, or go for that mid-morning run to boost your productivity. We want you to have the best of both worlds. We offer 25 days annual leave in addition to public holidays (up to 5 day rollover), as well as flexible time off allowances for any ad-hoc childcare/family/caring needs. We offer 12 weeks paid maternity leave and up to 4 weeks paid paternity leave for employees with over 12 months service We will support you with your career endeavours. We are committed to internal progression, and offering our team members the best opportunities for growth. We want to invest in you the same way you're going to invest in us! We want you to invest in your future too, so we have a pension with Aviva - très chic! If you love cycling as much as we do, keep yourself physically fit with our Evans Cycles Ride to Work scheme And after a long weeks work, join us in undoing it all - with membership to The Wine Society. (They also do gin and beer!) We want everyone to achieve "zen mastery" with a free subscription to Calm — work can be stressful (we know!) and we want to help you switch off And the best benefit of all... Free access to Wagestream service - naturally!

Our strategy is to incorporate population health management into our work alongside providing excellent clinical services, in order to advance the health of the people and communities we serve and to intervene earlier in people’s care. We are seeking to recruit a highly motivated, proactive and enthusiastic individual to join the small strategy and commissioning team as we implement this strategy.

Working to the Director of Strategic Analytics, Economics and Population Health Management and through matrix working with clinical colleagues, you will play a key role in supporting the work required for transformation change in our approach to collaboration and integration with other health, Council and voluntary and community sector partners.

Shortlisting date is planned for week commencing 23rd August

Interview date is TBC

The post holder will be part of the Population health analytical team. The post holder will participate actively in the formulation of Trust Population Health Strategy. They will work collaborative across the health and care system, engaging in and developing external networks and partnerships.
The post holder will support the Director on the development and implementation of a population health strategy for Mersey Care, which will also be the basis of a population health management strategy for all NHS organisations and the local authorities. Working with a high level of technical and analytical capability, the post holder will work collaboratively across the health and care system, building analytical capability in external networks and partnerships with local universities, acute Trusts, primary care networks and local authorities to improve health outcomes in the local population.

Mersey Care NHS Foundation Trust provides specialist inpatient and community mental health, learning disabilities, addiction and acquired brain injury services for the people of Liverpool, Sefton and Kirkby, Merseyside. We also provide community physical health services in
Liverpool, Sefton, secure mental health services for the North West of England, the West Midlands and Wales and specialist learning disability services across Lancashire, Greater Manchester, Cheshire and Merseyside.

Our ambition is to deliver perfect care to become the world’s leading organisation in holistic health and well being.

Mersey Care’s vision and values of Continuous Improvement, Accountability, Respect, Enthusiasm and Support (CARES) drive our organisation and the way we work together to deliver services. Applicants will be expected to demonstrate, during recruitment and any subsequent employment with the Trust, that their behaviour supports our values.Show more

listing_jobDesc: Conducting research to identify data sources and data products for specific client requirements Building connectors to data sources, QA-ing and wrangling datasets to conform to ThinkData standards Wrangling and analyzing existing datasets to solve a specific problem Creating visualizations or otherwise packaging datasets as data products as solutions to specific problems Communicating with clients and maintaining 1-3 active client deployments concurrently Design and build data products. Knowledge of any additional programming languages is an asset. Wrangle data. You have had hands-on experience with data wrangling using scripts and a variety of tools, such as Pandas, OpenRefine or similar. You are familiar with basic statistical concepts. Visualize data. You have working knowledge of one more visualization tools: Tableau, Excel, Power BI etc. and have the ability to quickly learn new tools. Go Beyond. You are tenacious and enjoy solving a wide variety of problems – be it research, data wrangling, or data analysis – and possess the ability to think outside the box to reach solutions. You can switch contexts easily going from heads down research one day to data wrangling on another to building connectors on yet another. Collaborate. You can work as part of the team, or work autonomously. You are adaptable, flexible, and able to adjust to a dynamic startup environment. Previous experience working at a startup environment is an asset Evolve with us. The landscape is being built under our feet as we move forward, so we need people who can channel their passion, learn quickly, and navigate the unknown at top speed. Knowledge. You will be given the tools and the support you need – from everyone on our Data, Engineering, and Leadership teams – to succeed in this role. The chance to make an impact. You’ll be working on the front-lines of data, delivering solutions directly to our clients, with real ownership over your projects. Access to new tech. At ThinkData we don’t shy away from bleeding edge tech. We encourage you to experiment, test, and push the boundaries through research and development. Career growth. This role will change and evolve as we continue to grow. We want you to be able to carve out your own career path here.

Strong programming skills as evidenced by earlier work in data science or software engineering. Although your programming language of choice (e.g. R, MATLAB or C) is not important, we do require the ability to become a fluent Python programmer in a short timeframe. A high level of mathematical competence and proficiency in statistics. A solid grasp of machine learning with the ability to develop new algorithms when an innovative solution is necessary. An excellent command of the standard libraries for data science (NumPy, Pandas, Scikit-Learn, Keras or equivalents in other programming languages). An appreciation for the scientific method as applied to the commercial world; a talent for converting business problems into a mathematical framework; resourcefulness in overcoming difficulties through creativity and commitment; a rigorous mindset in evaluating the performance and impact of models upon deployment. Eagerness to work alongside our customers and to learn about the commercial aspects of the job. Effective verbal and written communication. You should be comfortable with presenting your work in front of customers. Experience composing and following a project plan/sticking to self-imposed deadlines/proactively solving your own problems. Prior research experience (PhD or Postdoc) as evidenced by academic publications and conference talks. Some knowledge of: Deep-learning frameworks such as TensorFlow and PyTorch; Probabilistic programming languages such as Stan, PyMC3, Edward or Greta; Database programming languages, in particular SQL; Distributed-computing frameworks such as Spark and Dask; Utilities for the creation of web apps such as Flask, Dash and React.js; Contributions to open-source projects Prior commercial experience, particularly if this involved customer-facing work or project management. A learning environment: Faculty is dedicated to growing and learning. This translates into dedicated learning time every Friday morning, pair programming with a more experienced engineer, frequent lunch and learns, and plenty of tech talks. Genuinely flexible working: We believe people have needs, responsibilities and interests that require something different to a strict 9-6 working day. We trust people to organise and take accountability for their own work and do our best to support their lives outside Faculty. Unlimited holidays Cycle to work £100 Work from Home equipment fund for any work-essential tech or home office equipment (on top of your laptop, of course) Access to TechScheme monthly personal tech repayment process Pension Sanctus mental health Telephone call Coding Test Technical Interview Final Interview

About The RoleFoxtons is rapidly expanding the functions provided by the Data Services department, as Foxtons look to leverage its existing data and technology. A key strategic growth driver is to increase the adoption and usage of data science throughout the business. Key stakeholders across the business, from board level down, are looking for ways in which data science can enable significant growth in revenue and profitability. This is a very exciting time to join a rapidly expanding team, who are looking for an ambitious and motivated candidate who can contribute to the overall growth and development of the department.Foxtons has just invested in the largest AI modelling software in the world. The platform allows rapid iteration on hundreds of models, data preparation steps and parameters that would usually take days or weeks to do manually. The candidate will have overall responsibility for the building, management and deployment of models across the business. The candidate will be required to be responsible for the entire modelling lifecycle, from understanding the business requirement, framing the data question, building the model, deploying the model as well as measuring and quantifying business uplift and ROI.An ideal candidate will be an experienced business /data analyst who is looking for their next steps and are looking to develop into a data scientist. They’ll be very experienced with writing complex SQL queries to be able to combine and aggregate data together. In addition, the candidate will have good experience managing large projects and working with key stakeholders on business initiatives.About The CompanyAt Foxtons, we’re famous for setting the standard in property. We do this by hiring brilliant people to help achieve our goal of being the best place for our customers to find their dream home or unlock the value of their property investment.Over the last 30 years we’ve built a network of almost 60 branches and a strong operational infrastructure that enables our teams to achieve the highest standards in delivering exceptional service to our customers. Award-winning training ensures our teams have the strong local expertise that our customers expect from us, while our market-leading technology empowers all our staff to provide the best customer experience possible.Apply Now!Show more

Capture and refine requirements for marketing analysis and customer insight projects briefed in by the marketing, e-commerce and retail teams Extract data from the data warehouse and employ analysis and modelling techniques in order to deliver on these requirements Present analytical outputs to key stakeholders, taking complex information and communicating it as clear and actionable insights Build, automate, monitor and improve analyses and models that support ongoing decision-making with a particular focus on marketing attribution, retail modelling, customer segmentation and lifetime value Leverage your technical capabilities and innate curiosity to proactively identify opportunities to improve marketing and wider business performance An A-player Data Scientist with at least 5 years' experience using data science and predictive modelling to tackle business problems, ideally related to marketing A talented student of mathematics and statistics with experience studying computer science a bonus calibre A mastery of R, SQL with experience working with AWS. Knowledge of Linux environments would be ideal too Exceptional problem-solving & logical thinking skills with an ability to innovatively deal with complex problems A fusspot about detail with a relentless commitment to delivering outstanding work to agreed deadlines An excellent communicator and an ability to connect and influence people across all areas of the business (so you need to be able to laugh at yourself!) Always on the look-out to improve how things are done, challenging the status quo and never accepting second best Happy working under pressure in a fast-paced environment (we know, everyone says that!), bringing a positive vibe to work every day no matter what curve balls are thrown

Producing meaningful data forensics to support the delivery of tuning related initiatives Creating, building and maintaining analytical tools through programming to generate insight, recognise patterns and predict behaviour Experimenting with and identifying various analytical methods/ techniques best suited to data challenges Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis Responding to ad-hoc requests and communicating the results of any analysis, trends and MI to a range of audiences whilst effectively managing your workload Having an active interest in all aspects of technological infrastructure Developing an understanding of Financial Crime preventative measures, systems and operational processes within Barclays Supporting the delivery of automation initiatives in-line with the wider Group strategy Excellent analytical and quantitative skills to support Sanctions (Financial Crime Operations) and work with a diverse range of colleagues across multiple sites Good presentation skills with ability to explain sophisticated solutions to a non-technical audience Ability to apply problem solving and continuous improvement Degree or track record in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or related scientific disciplines

Fully Remote Working anywhere in the UK (expectation to attend occasional meetings in Portsmouth or Newport) Self-Employed Contractor Posts - Inside IR35 Duration: 31st March 2022 at the earliest Work as part of a cross-disciplinary team to deliver ground-breaking data science projects in one or more of the core Campus themes: the economy, the environment, society Deliver innovative data science for the public sector, exploring and applying new data sources, tools and techniques or approaches to meet our clients' needs, and using your coding and analytical skills Develop software tools, hardware infrastructure or data products that exploit state of the art research to place technology in the hands of the operational users Use Agile project delivery methodology to deliver effectively and efficiently Ensure work delivers value by understanding and addressing user needs Write and publish code to quality standards Contribute to technical reports, working papers, and journal articles Senior Data Scientists will also: Lead or co-lead a cross-disciplinary team of around 5-6 data scientists and the associated projects through the project life cycle, from scoping projects through to delivery of projects with impact * Collaborate with industry partners, academia and charities, as well as across government and international partners * Write technical reports Identify and engage with stakeholders confidently, using a high level of interpersonal and written communication skills Communicate effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences at all levels Act as an ambassador for the Campus and the public sector data science community Deliver technical advice to our partners A track record of delivering data science projects on time, to meet user needs, and overcoming any challenges A demonstrable commitment to developing your knowledge and expertise as well as that of others Good knowledge and experience of coding in Python and/or R Data Science is an intensely multidisciplinary practice with a continually evolving skill set. You should be able to demonstrate significant expertise (Grade 7), in at least one of the following areas. We do not expect any one person to cover all the skills. Data analytics - such as supervised and un-supervised machine learning (including deep learning),natural language processing, geospatial analysis, econometrics and regression, microdata, network analysis, agent-based modelling, time series analysis, reinforcement learning, and causal inference Data management/curation - such as the manipulation and analysis of complex, high volume and high dimensionality data, distributed processing, relational and non-relational databases, cloud storage and data management, interoperability and standardisation for data, metadata management, knowledge of UK datasets Data engineering - such as the design of algorithms, implementation of big data solutions, multi-core/distributed processing, SQL and NoSQL database systems, statistical analysis languages and tooling Storytelling and data visualisation - including the visualisation of insights drawn from data and thebuilding of data driven products Scientific research methods - analytical, critical, and curious analysis of data or modelling, ability tomaster the scientific literature, a track record of high-quality publications Software engineering - software installation and distribution, algorithm and implementationoptimisation, design and/or implementation of user interfaces, and the software lifecycle A portfolio of open-source projects and contributions Any other tools, techniques or programming languages, for example, D3, HIVE tables, GPUprogramming experience.

Build, scale, and maintain data products based on machine learning, optimization, and other types of algorithms on Google Cloud Platform. We run all of this in containers on Kubernetes under the hood, but as a data scientist, you should only need to know how to write Python code to get your stuff into production! 
Develop and deploy your own data pipelines with feature engineering, model training, and whatever else you need to get the job done. We use Argo Workflows to run all of our Python pipelines in containers, and dbt to run everything SQL on our Snowflake data warehouse. 
Work with product managers, data analysts, business representatives, and other stakeholders to understand their problems and design clever algorithmic solutions, and make sure we properly define success for improvements, establish baselines, and measure effects. 
Perform complex data analysis, communicate insights tailored to different audiences, and make recommendations based on your findings that contribute to company strategic decisions. We strive to preach and practice decision intelligence in organizational decision-making, and as a member of Data & Insight, you play a key role in these efforts. 
Contribute to our data- and insights-driven culture and community by sharing your knowledge and expertise with the team and with the company. We even have our own Data University, which is Data & Insight’s knowledge base and course catalog on everything from making correct decisions based on data to building better data products. 
Have some years of experience working as a data scientist in a business or research setting. 
Feel productive with Python and SQL, and enjoy both building things and extracting insights from data. 
Know how to apply different algorithms to solve different problems — whether it is ARIMA models for forecasting or neural networks for product recommendations — and are excited to expand your comfort zone by learning new methods and diving deeper into particular subfields. 
Have a structured approach to solving both narrowly scoped and open-ended problems, with the ability to both find optimal solutions and make appropriate cost/benefit tradeoffs. 
Are able to communicate and empathize with customers and colleagues when trying to understand their problems, needs, and desires. 
Can work independently, manage your own time, and take ownership of tasks from start to finish in a dynamic environment where priorities are subject to change along the way while thriving in teams where everyone contributes their best work. 
Are eager to continuously develop, nurture and share skills through feedback and learning, together with the people around you. 
Fluency in English. 
Have a Master’s degree within a technical/engineering field or quantitative field, like computer science, physics, economics, statistics, mathematics, etc. 
Possess a strong analytical mindset, combined with creativity in the face of novel problems, and curiosity and daring when venturing into unknown territory. 
The opportunity to make a lasting mark on the daily lives of the people around you, through a product that truly contributes to their general well-being. 
A large, tight-knit Data & Insight specialist community — there are over 30 of us embedded in various teams within the company at the time of writing, and we all maintain strong ties even though we work in widely different areas! 
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development and progression in a fast-growing, ever-changing tech company with new challenges and opportunities to solve meaningful, previously unsolved problems around every corner. We make it a priority to facilitate internal promotion and mobility so you can keep growing within the company. 
Enthusiastic colleagues who truly care about supporting and helping others. 
An onboarding program where all new employees get to work hands-on in delivery, picking, replenishment, and customer service — in addition to our Data & Insight-specific onboarding. 
Get to know our way of working with OKR's — a framework we share with Google, Twitter, and Uber — and Flow, our own system for working within and between development teams to create value. 
A transparent workplace where we use Quip and Slack to communicate, discuss and share what we are working on, and stay in the loop with fewer e-mails and meetings. 
A culture that embraces and celebrates differences, built on tolerance, collaboration, and compassion. We actively seek to hire people with differences in education, personality, skillset, life experience, and knowledge base. 
The possibility to take stock in the success of the company.

Develop, validate, implement and commercialise molecular biological analyses with a focus on NGS Responsible for the establishment and maintenance of bioinformatics pipelines and databases for community analysis The work will primarily be related to bioinformatics, but some practical analytic work may also be expected You will also be responsible for guiding colleagues and customers Have a good collaboration with our laboratory engineers, product developers, sales and R&D, as well as with Zoetis’ global ITS department Master's degree or equivalent in bioinformatics or similar Experience with one or more programming languages (such as Python, Perl, or R) Experience with genetic engineering methods and method development - and knowledge of relevant computer tools Knowledge of the establishment and maintenance of bioinformatics pipelines and databases Knowledge of epidemiological tracking tools: software for analysis, interpretation, databases and statistics Experience with statistics, collection, processing, compilation, linking and production of big data Experience with aquaculture and fish health, as well as knowledge of microbial ecology, is an advantage You must be a team player in an environment characterised by high pace, and at the same time be good at ensuring progress on your own. Work closely with our Chief Growth Officer to build our growth models, shape our growth strategy and enable the entire Growth function to work with actionable insights: We are ramping up our organization by increasing our growth teams, whose work spans across marketing and product, led by our Chief Growth Officer Yara Paoli. You will work on, and further develop, our powerful insight infrastructure with a core focus on enabling others to become data-literate and use data to meet our growth ambitions. Growth models, growth loops, growth funnel optimization, as well as habit formation, hacking the key to a great viral coefficient, and forecasting new growth levers’ impact are only a few of the interesting problems ahead. On top of this you will deal with solving the full spectrum of marketing enablement from attribution modelling to incrementality testing, to marketing automation and next-best action scenarios within a lifecycle analysis context. 
Attract, recruit and onboard data professionals: You attract and hire the best talent, and help them get up to speed and feel welcome - regardless of whether they are straight out of school or seasoned professionals. 
Raise the bar in the Data and Growth Science discipline: Advocate and continuously improve all skills related to Data & Insight indirectly through leads and managers in your platform area. Develop a team culture, routines, standards and systems that encourages Data Scientist and Data Analysts to help and push each other to be better. This role in particular will also set the standard for how to enable data insights for best-in-class growth methodology.
 Enable our data professionals to grow: You set expectations, enhance motivation, give feedback and support in the development of each data professional either directly or indirectly by building up and leading other managers. You are an inspiring leader and a great mentor as well as being flexible and capable of leading by example if necessary. 
Create the conditions for value creation from data: Ensure that data professionals have what they need to do their best possible work, be it tools, materials, space, lack of distractions, stakeholder management, time for experimentation or research, training, inspiration, or advocacy. You also make sure we catch opportunities for collaboration across platform areas and teams, and contribute to the continuous improvement of our Data & Insight discipline. 
Give back and share: Ensure that we actively share learnings and opinions with others around us both internally and externally via our blog on Medium, talks and other relevant forums, and in particular around your discipline and its solution areas. 
The opportunity to leave a lasting mark and impression on the daily lives of the people around you, through a product that truly contributes to their general well-being. 
A large, tight-knit Data & Insight specialist community — there are 35 of us in various teams within the company at the time of writing, and we all maintain strong ties even though we work in widely different areas! 
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development and progression in a fast growing, ever-changing tech company with new challenges and opportunities to solve meaningful, previously unsolved problems around every corner. We make it a priority to facilitate internal promotion and mobility so you can keep growing within the company. 
Enthusiastic colleagues who truly care about helping others. 
An onboarding program where all new employees get to work hands-on in delivery, picking, replenishment and customer service — in addition to our Data & Insight-specific onboarding. 
Get to know our way of working with OKR's— a framework we share with Google, Twitter and Uber — and Flow, our own system for working within and between development teams to create value. 
A transparent workplace where we use Quip and Slack to communicate, discuss and share what we are working on, and stay on the loop with less e-mails and meetings. 
Possibility to invest in private company stock options. 
Help with relocation provided if your favorite option is Oslo or Berlin, alternatively we will be open to discuss a remote setup in compatible time zones. Travel, once permitted, will however be required. 
Proven experience as a leader and as a manager of data professionals, ideally across multiple teams, within analytical disciplines, including recruitment and building up teams. 
Passionate about creating a great data and insight culture.
 Experience working hands-on as in analytical roles, such as data engineer, data analyst or data scientist, in a modern product & tech company. 
Know how to set and align on a great strategy where data is a key component, communicate it effectively and execute on it across several teams and areas. 
Know how to organize analytical roles and teams in a way that secures great impact, balances autonomy with alignment, and really engages people — you’ve tried different models and know what works and when. 
Manage a large and varied set of stakeholders across a big organization. 
Have a passion for understanding causes behind the exponential growth of certain tech start-ups, for growth strategies and are familiar with the reasons that led to the rise and fall of growth hacking. 
Understand marketing and the complexities of channel discovery, optimization and experimentation at scale. 
Open to travel from time-to-time and capable of leading remote teams as effectively as those on-site with you. 
Master’s degree or higher within a technical and/or quantitative field, such as computer science, mathematics, statistics, physics or economics. 
Proven track record of attracting and recruiting skilled talent in the Data & Insight Discipline, and enabling them to be great. 
Experienced in working on data enablement for marketing and/or growth cross-functional teams. 
Speak and write fluently in English (additional languages is a plus).

company_offeredRole: Director of Data & Insight - Shop Platform
listing_jobDesc:
Provide senior leadership and contribute to strategy: Lead the Data & Insight discipline in the Shop Platform area and be one of the key people in the overall management of the Data & Insight discipline. You are also responsible for the Data & Insight strategy for this area, by ensuring strong value creation from data in the strategy, execution and impact of the teams in the Shop platform for both data science applications and insights. To do this you work with other disciplines to ensure that data science can power the product development where applicable, all the way from product ideation to amazing machine learning models running in production. 
Attract, recruit and onboard data professionals: You attract and hire the best talent, and help them get up to speed and feel welcome - regardless of whether they are straight out of school or seasoned professionals. 
Raise the bar in Data & Insight: Advocate and continuously improve all skills related to Data & Insight indirectly through leads and managers in your platform area. Develop a team culture, routines, standards and systems that encourages Data Scientist and Data Analysts to help and push each other to be better.
 Enable our data professionals to grow: You set expectations, enhance motivation, give feedback and support in the development of each data professional either directly or indirectly by building up and leading other managers. You are an inspiring leader and a great mentor as well as being flexible and capable of leading by example if necessary. 
Create the conditions for value creation from data: Ensure that data professionals have what they need to do their best possible work, be it tools, materials, space, lack of distractions, stakeholder management, time for experimentation or research, training, inspiration, or advocacy. You also make sure we catch opportunities for collaboration across platform areas and teams, and contribute to the continuous improvement of our Data & Insight discipline. 
Give back and share: Ensure that we actively share learnings and opinions with others around us both internally and externally via our blog on Medium, talks and other relevant forums, and in particular around your discipline and its solution areas. 
The opportunity to leave a lasting mark and impression on the daily lives of the people around you, through a product that truly contributes to their general well-being. 
A large, tight-knit Data & Insight specialist community — there are 35 of us in various teams within the company at the time of writing, and we all maintain strong ties even though we work in widely different areas! 
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development and progression in a fast growing, ever-changing tech company with new challenges and opportunities to solve meaningful, previously unsolved problems around every corner. We make it a priority to facilitate internal promotion and mobility so you can keep growing within the company. 
Enthusiastic colleagues who truly care about helping others. 
An onboarding program where all new employees get to work hands-on in delivery, picking, replenishment and customer service — in addition to our Data & Insight-specific onboarding. 
Get to know our way of working with OKR's— a framework we share with Google, Twitter and Uber — and Flow, our own system for working within and between development teams to create value. 
A transparent workplace where we use Quip and Slack to communicate, discuss and share what we are working on, and stay on the loop with less e-mails and meetings. 
Possibility to invest in private company stock options. 
Help with relocation provided if your favorite option is Oslo or Berlin, alternatively we will be open to discuss a remote setup in compatible time zones. Travel, once permitted, will however be required. 
Proven experience as a leader and as a manager of data professionals, ideally across multiple teams, within analytical disciplines, including recruitment and building up teams. 
Passionate about creating a great data and insight culture.
 Experience working hands-on as in analytical roles, such as data engineer, data analyst or data scientist, in a modern product & tech company. 
Know how to set and align on a great strategy where data is a key component, communicate it effectively and execute on it across several teams and areas. 
Know how to organise analytical roles and teams in a way that secures great impact, balances autonomy with alignment, and really engages people — you’ve tried different models and know what works and when. 
Manage a large and varied set of stakeholders across a big organization. 
Open to travel from time-to-time and capable of leading remote teams as effectively as those on-site with you. 
aMaster’s degree or higher within a technical and/or quantitative field, such as computer science, mathematics, statistics, physics or economics. 
Proven track record of attracting and recruiting skilled talent in the Data & Insight Discipline, and enabling them to be great. 
Experienced in working on data enablement for customer focused cross-functional teams. 
Speak and write fluently in English (additional languages is a plus). 
We not only look for hard skills when recruiting to Oda, we also search for a fit in mindset and culture. A strong analytical mindset is important in this role, combined with creativity in the face of novel problems, curiosity and daring when venturing into unknown territory. We want all employees to have empathy for customers and colleagues when trying to understand their problems, needs and desires. You are pragmatic when needed, and enjoy a dynamic everyday life where priorities and needs change. You are also a lifelong learner — we are big on sharing knowledge. 
Master’s degree or higher within a technical and/or quantitative field, such as computer science, mathematics, statistics, physics or economics. 
Proven track record of attracting and recruiting skilled talent in the Data & Insight Discipline, and enabling them to be great. 
Experienced in working on data enablement for customer focused cross-functional teams. 
Speak and write fluently in English (additional languages is a plus).

Sterk analysefaglig kompetanse, på tvers av maskinlæring, statistisk modellering og relaterte teknikker
 Sterk dataforståelse, med evne til å forstå og modellere dataenes livssyklus fra kilde, via dataintegrasjon og kontekstualisering mot masterdata, gjennom analytiske modeller (feildeteksjon, feilprediksjon, avviksdeteksjon) og ut i de operasjonelle anvendelsene
 Sterk teknisk kompetanse, inkludert forståelse for hvordan analytiske modeller opererer effektivt på store data i et produksjonsmiljø, herunder også god kunnskap om ulike database- og datalagringsteknologier (SQL, data lakes m.m.)
 God kjennskap til Python (som vårt primære programmeringsspråk på data science-fronten), og spesifikt data- og analysearbeid i Python 
God forståelse i samspillet mellom backend, data science og domenespesialist, herunder hva som bør programmeres i C# og hva som bør programmeres i python og viktigheten av gode brukerhistorier.

company_offeredRole: SYSCO søker nye teknologiske superhelter som vil jobbe med Data Science og Data Engineering!
listing_jobDesc:
Du har inngående kunnskap om deler av energibransjen og du har matematikk-/statistikk-kompetanse på et meget høyt nivå. Du har jobbet som Data Scientist i minst 2 år og har gode programmeringsferdigheter innen språk som Python eller R, samt erfaring med databaseteknologier og SQL eller ulike big data-teknologier. God kompetanse på datamodellering/evaluering og tidsserieanalyser er viktig i denne stillingen. Kompetanse på nevrale nettverk og Reinforcement Learning er en fordel. 
Du er god til å formidle og visualisere data. Du jobber med våre kunders data på en måte som ivaretar sikkerhetskrav og GDPR. 
Du er god til å utvikle use case, konkretisere og implementere. Du jobber godt i team med data engineers og kundens brukere. Dersom du har erfaring med DataOps er dette en fordel. Du holder deg oppdatert på nye teknologier og vil være våre kunders rådgiver på disse. 
Du kan bistå i tilbudsskrivning og presentere vårt budskap. Kanskje liker du også å stå på en scene og formidle hva vi kan få til? 
Jobbe tett med våre kunder i alle faser. 
Du vil sette deg inn i kundens behov og jobbe i team med andre konsulenter. 
Du vil jobbe med utvikling av løsninger som skaper kundeverdi og der kunden ikke allerede har valgt plattform og løsning, vil dine råd bli tillagt stor vekt. 
Du vil sammen med oss bidra til å forme og bygge videre et ledende miljø i Norge innen Big Data og Analytics. 
Gode muligheter for utvikling av egen kompetanse og karriere i en innovasjons- og kompetansedrevet organisasjon 
Sosiale events 
En flat struktur, stor frihet og rask vei til avgjørelser 
Utfordrende og varierte prosjekter 
Gode forsikringsordninger 
Når grensene åpnes og det er tid for ferie kan vi også friste med mulighet til å booke en av våre leiligheter i Spania Send melding
 Send melding
 Hjemmeside
 Flere stillinger fra Sysco AS

company_offeredRole: Director of Data & Insight - Logistics Platform
listing_jobDesc:
purchasing, procurement and inventory fulfillment of orders, including picking and dispatch end to end distribution including delivery offering, route planning and on-road transportation management and driver tools
 
Provide senior leadership and contribute to strategy: Lead the Data & Insight discipline in the Logistics Platform area and be one of the key people in the overall management of the Data & Insight discipline. You are also responsible for the Data & Insight strategy for this area, by ensuring strong value creation from data in the strategy, execution and impact of the teams in the Logistics platform for both data science applications and insights.
 Attract, recruit and onboard data professionals: You attract and hire the best talent, and help them get up to speed and feel welcome - regardless of whether they are straight out of school or seasoned professionals. 
Raise the bar in Data & Insight: Advocate and continuously improve all skills related to Data & Insight indirectly through leads and managers in your platform area. Develop a team culture, routines, standards and systems that encourages Data Scientist and Data Analysts to help and push each other to be better.
 Enable our data professionals to grow: You set expectations, enhance motivation, give feedback and support in the development of each data professional either directly or indirectly by building up and leading other managers. You are an inspiring leader and a great mentor as well as being flexible and capable of leading by example if necessary. 
Create the conditions for value creation from data: Ensure that data professionals have what they need to do their best possible work, be it tools, materials, space, lack of distractions, stakeholder management, time for experimentation or research, training, inspiration, or advocacy. You also make sure we catch opportunities for collaboration across platform areas and teams, and contribute to the continuous improvement of our Data & Insight discipline. 
Give back and share: Ensure that we actively share learnings and opinions with others around us both internally and externally via our blog on Medium, talks and other relevant forums, and in particular around your discipline and its solution areas. 
The opportunity to leave a lasting mark and impression on the daily lives of the people around you, through a product that truly contributes to their general well-being. 
A large, tight-knit Data & Insight specialist community — there are 35 of us in various teams within the company at the time of writing, and we all maintain strong ties even though we work in widely different areas! 
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development and progression in a fast growing, ever-changing tech company with new challenges and opportunities to solve meaningful, previously unsolved problems around every corner. We make it a priority to facilitate internal promotion and mobility so you can keep growing within the company. 
Enthusiastic colleagues who truly care about helping others. 
An onboarding program where all new employees get to work hands-on in delivery, picking, replenishment and customer service — in addition to our Data & Insight-specific onboarding. 
Get to know our way of working with OKR's— a framework we share with Google, Twitter and Uber — and Flow, our own system for working within and between development teams to create value. 
A transparent workplace where we use Quip and Slack to communicate, discuss and share what we are working on, and stay on the loop with less e-mails and meetings. 
Possibility to invest in private company stock options. 
Help with relocation provided if your favorite option is Oslo or Berlin, alternatively we will be open to discuss a remote setup in compatible time zones. Travel, once permitted, will however be required. 
Proven experience as a leader and as a manager of data professionals, ideally across multiple teams, within analytical disciplines, including recruitment and building up teams. 
Passionate about creating a great data and insight culture.
 Experience working hands-on as in analytical roles, such as data engineer, data analyst or data scientist, in a modern product & tech company. 
Know how to set and align on a great strategy where data is a key component, communicate it effectively and execute on it across several teams and areas. 
Know how to organise analytical roles and teams in a way that secures great impact, balances autonomy with alignment, and really engages people — you’ve tried different models and know what works and when. 
Manage a large and varied set of stakeholders across a big organization. 
Open to travel from time-to-time and capable of leading remote teams as effectively as those on-site with you. 
Master’s degree or higher within a technical and/or quantitative field, such as computer science, mathematics, statistics, physics or economics. 
Proven track record of attracting and recruiting skilled talent in the Data & Insight Discipline, and enabling them to be great. 
Experienced in working on data enablement for customer focused cross-functional teams. 
Speak and write fluently in English (additional languages is a plus).

company_offeredRole: Senior / Principal Research Scientist within Smart Cities
listing_jobDesc:
Will you join us working in the research area Smart Cities? We are growing fast and looking for Senior to Principal Research Scientists with a curious and collaborative attitude who are energized to conduct research for a better future within our highlighted research fields:
Digital ecosystems for smart cities (smart environments, intelligent systems, distributed systems, data management)
Data-sharing in smart cities (data markets, data governance, privacy and security preserving technologies, data engineering, distributed ledger technologies, big data technologies, ontologies/taxonomies)
Data-driven citizen centred service innovation in smart cities (public services, mobility, sharing economy)
Resilient cities (Cyber security, situation awareness, emergency preparedness, intelligent city infrastructure)
Sustainable smart cities (energy informatics, digitalised water production and distribution, citizen behaviour change, climate change mitigation and adaptation)
As part of the smart city research area, IFE has joined the My Digital City program (https://mydigitalcity.no) together with Smart Innovation Norway, Østfold University College and Halden municipality. The program aims to drive interdisciplinary research-driven innovation on smart cities.
Position information:
As a Senior to Principal Research Scientist, you will have a well-paid permanent position where 100% of your time is dedicated to research activity (no teaching unless you wish to have a connection to a university, as well). You will spend your time working with private and public parties to carry out applied research work, generating scientific publications, and seeking new research opportunities and funding. You will be surrounded by distinguished colleagues with multidisciplinary research backgrounds in an inclusive workplace with strong national and international networks in research and industry.
Our requirements:
You should have:
PhD and research focus in one or more of our research fields. Given our multidisciplinary focus, expertise in more than one of the fields would be advantageous
A strong publication record in the last 5-10 years in these research fields
Track record of successful grant proposal writing
Track record of leading research projects through to success
A strong international network
You should be fluent in English
You should be interested in creating research groups around your research interests and mentoring junior researchers
Required expertise:
Artificial intelligence; Data science; Cyber security; Virtual reality, Augmented reality, and spatial computing; Robotics and cyber-physical systems; Interaction with complex data and advanced modelling; Modelling and simulation of physical systems; Digital twins;
Human-centred digitalisation; Human-centered artificial intelligence; Humans and automation collaboration; Interaction design; Risk safety management; Human reliability; Organisational psychology; Cognitive psychology
We offer:
A permanent position fully dedicated to research activity
Research tasks in fields that have great potential for large societal impact
Considerable freedom to develop research projects in the direction of your interests
A large degree of autonomy and flexible working hours
Multidisciplinary work environment
Access to state-of-the-art laboratories
A well-established and wide ranging national and international network within research and industry
Growing and healthy organisation that is focused on individual and group development
A very competitive salary with a good pension plan
How to Apply?

Cover Letter
Curriculum Vitae
Location: Halden in Norway. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kd769TCkHRA

We place great emphasis on your personal suitability for the position. IFE is subject to the National Security Act, and the candidate must be able to pass a background check and must be able to obtain security clearance and authorization.

Working as part of our Data Team, you’ll collaborate with other teams to understand their problems and provide them with actionable data analyses Carry out quantitative analysis and modelling to support business objectives using appropriate methods Play a key role in managing data collection (tracking), and assuring data quality and compliance Contribute to our data culture by teaching and supporting others to use our analytic tools effectively Maintain and create new ETLs and API connections to integrate datasets in our data warehouse Be a point of contact for advising product managers, leaders and stakeholders on controlled experiment design and measurement (A/B testing) A degree in a numerate or computing-related subject 3-5 years experience in a similar position Proficient using SQL Fluent using Python and bash Ability to visualise and interpret complex data sets Familiarity with common tools such as Google Analytics/Amplitude and ability to learn new tools quickly Experience using business intelligence tools (Tableau, PowerBI, Thoughtspot…) Experience designing and measuring A/B Tests Experience setting up ETL processes Excellent communication and presentation skills Experience connecting APIs into data warehouses Experience building ML models (Scikit-learn, Tensorflow…)
 Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery, Cloud Storage) A competitive compensation package Share option plan A fast growing environment International work environment with over 40 nationalities An informal, fun and driven culture Flexible working Remote work set-up Social and company events (virtual and in person)

Work closely with our Chief Growth Officer to build our growth models, shape our growth strategy and enable the entire Growth function to work with actionable insights: We are ramping up our organization by increasing our growth teams, whose work spans across marketing and product, led by our Chief Growth Officer Yara Paoli. You will work on, and further develop, our powerful insight infrastructure with a core focus on enabling others to become data-literate and use data to meet our growth ambitions. Growth models, growth loops, growth funnel optimization, as well as habit formation, hacking the key to a great viral coefficient, and forecasting new growth levers’ impact are only a few of the interesting problems ahead. On top of this you will deal with solving the full spectrum of marketing enablement from attribution modelling to incrementality testing, to marketing automation and next-best action scenarios within a lifecycle analysis context. 
Attract, recruit and onboard data professionals: You attract and hire the best talent, and help them get up to speed and feel welcome - regardless of whether they are straight out of school or seasoned professionals. 
Raise the bar in the Data and Growth Science discipline: Advocate and continuously improve all skills related to Data & Insight indirectly through leads and managers in your platform area. Develop a team culture, routines, standards and systems that encourages Data Scientist and Data Analysts to help and push each other to be better. This role in particular will also set the standard for how to enable data insights for best-in-class growth methodology.
 Enable our data professionals to grow: You set expectations, enhance motivation, give feedback and support in the development of each data professional either directly or indirectly by building up and leading other managers. You are an inspiring leader and a great mentor as well as being flexible and capable of leading by example if necessary. 
Create the conditions for value creation from data: Ensure that data professionals have what they need to do their best possible work, be it tools, materials, space, lack of distractions, stakeholder management, time for experimentation or research, training, inspiration, or advocacy. You also make sure we catch opportunities for collaboration across platform areas and teams, and contribute to the continuous improvement of our Data & Insight discipline. 
Give back and share: Ensure that we actively share learnings and opinions with others around us both internally and externally via our blog on Medium, talks and other relevant forums, and in particular around your discipline and its solution areas. 
The opportunity to leave a lasting mark and impression on the daily lives of the people around you, through a product that truly contributes to their general well-being. 
A large, tight-knit Data & Insight specialist community — there are 35 of us in various teams within the company at the time of writing, and we all maintain strong ties even though we work in widely different areas! 
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development and progression in a fast growing, ever-changing tech company with new challenges and opportunities to solve meaningful, previously unsolved problems around every corner. We make it a priority to facilitate internal promotion and mobility so you can keep growing within the company. 
Enthusiastic colleagues who truly care about helping others. 
An onboarding program where all new employees get to work hands-on in delivery, picking, replenishment and customer service — in addition to our Data & Insight-specific onboarding. 
Get to know our way of working with OKR's— a framework we share with Google, Twitter and Uber — and Flow, our own system for working within and between development teams to create value. 
A transparent workplace where we use Quip and Slack to communicate, discuss and share what we are working on, and stay on the loop with less e-mails and meetings. 
Possibility to invest in private company stock options. 
Help with relocation provided if your favorite option is Oslo or Berlin, alternatively we will be open to discuss a remote setup in compatible time zones. Travel, once permitted, will however be required. 
Proven experience as a leader and as a manager of data professionals, ideally across multiple teams, within analytical disciplines, including recruitment and building up teams. 
Passionate about creating a great data and insight culture.
 Experience working hands-on as in analytical roles, such as data engineer, data analyst or data scientist, in a modern product & tech company. 
Know how to set and align on a great strategy where data is a key component, communicate it effectively and execute on it across several teams and areas. 
Know how to organize analytical roles and teams in a way that secures great impact, balances autonomy with alignment, and really engages people — you’ve tried different models and know what works and when. 
Manage a large and varied set of stakeholders across a big organization. 
Have a passion for understanding causes behind the exponential growth of certain tech start-ups, for growth strategies and are familiar with the reasons that led to the rise and fall of growth hacking. 
Understand marketing and the complexities of channel discovery, optimization and experimentation at scale. 
Open to travel from time-to-time and capable of leading remote teams as effectively as those on-site with you. 
Master’s degree or higher within a technical and/or quantitative field, such as computer science, mathematics, statistics, physics or economics. 
Proven track record of attracting and recruiting skilled talent in the Data & Insight Discipline, and enabling them to be great. 
Experienced in working on data enablement for marketing and/or growth cross-functional teams. 
Speak and write fluently in English (additional languages is a plus).

Develop, validate, implement and commercialise molecular biological analyses with a focus on NGS Responsible for the establishment and maintenance of bioinformatics pipelines and databases for community analysis The work will primarily be related to bioinformatics, but some practical analytic work may also be expected You will also be responsible for guiding colleagues and customers Have a good collaboration with our laboratory engineers, product developers, sales and R&D, as well as with Zoetis’ global ITS department Master's degree or equivalent in bioinformatics or similar Experience with one or more programming languages (such as Python, Perl, or R) Experience with genetic engineering methods and method development - and knowledge of relevant computer tools Knowledge of the establishment and maintenance of bioinformatics pipelines and databases Knowledge of epidemiological tracking tools: software for analysis, interpretation, databases and statistics Experience with statistics, collection, processing, compilation, linking and production of big data Experience with aquaculture and fish health, as well as knowledge of microbial ecology, is an advantage You must be a team player in an environment characterised by high pace, and at the same time be good at ensuring progress on your own. You love analytical work, you are structured, responsible, flexible, curious, solution-oriented and have great work capacity Good Norwegian and English skills, both written and oral.

Master's or bachelor’s degree or equivalent in computer science, mathematics or related technical disciplines.

Experience with ML tools to build models and analyze data (e.g. Python, R, scikit-learn, TF, PyTorch, ML.NET). 
Knowledge of distributed big-data computing systems (e.g. Spark, Hadoop, Hive, Azure ML).

Excellent communication and presentations skills. 
Leadership experience and a strong desire to embrace diverse perspectives in order to built inclusive products and features.

Working with cross-functional delivery teams to standardize, automate and expand our data science project delivery Extracting value from data via statistical and machine learning methods and deploying these solutions into production Communicating analysis to customer stakeholders Developing machine learning enhanced data products Putting analytical solutions into production Contributing to Arundo software products via a close collaboration with the engineering team 2-3 years experience in applying DS and ML to real-world problems Strong coding skills in Python and the Python data ecosystem, including: pandas, numpy, scikit-learn, scipy, SQL, visualization tools (matplotlib, seaborn, bokeh, plotly, etc.) Familiarity with deployment workflow tools: Azure, Docker, FastAPI, Flask, GithubActions, Make, etc. Solid knowledge of machine learning, statistical analysis and mathematical modelling. Min. master's degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics, engineering or a related field; relevant work experience can compensate Also interesting is if you have a background as an electrical or machine engineer and are familiar with industrial equipment A value driven company with an inclusive and autonomous culture If you have passion and drive you get the opportunity to steer and direct in relation to product and technologies You will be integral in "what we do and what we shall do" Collaborative environment with our offices in the US and EMEA Opportunity to work with cutting edge technology Fun environment - we take fun seriously and have appointed a VP of Fun Great lunches in our canteen Newly refurbished office in downtown Oslo, close to the castle Competitive salary and participation in the employee stock option program Pension plan, medical services membership, travel insurance

Build, scale, and maintain data products based on machine learning, optimization, and other types of algorithms on Google Cloud Platform. We run all of this in containers on Kubernetes under the hood, but as a data scientist, you should only need to know how to write Python code to get your stuff into production! 
Develop and deploy your own data pipelines with feature engineering, model training, and whatever else you need to get the job done. We use Argo Workflows to run all of our Python pipelines in containers, and dbt to run everything SQL on our Snowflake data warehouse. 
Work with product managers, data analysts, business representatives, and other stakeholders to understand their problems and design clever algorithmic solutions, and make sure we properly define success for improvements, establish baselines, and measure effects. 
Perform complex data analysis, communicate insights tailored to different audiences, and make recommendations based on your findings that contribute to company strategic decisions. We strive to preach and practice decision intelligence in organizational decision-making, and as a member of Data & Insight, you play a key role in these efforts. 
Contribute to our data- and insights-driven culture and community by sharing your knowledge and expertise with the team and with the company. We even have our own Data University, which is Data & Insight’s knowledge base and course catalog on everything from making correct decisions based on data to building better data products. 
Have some years of experience working as a data scientist in a business or research setting. 
Feel productive with Python and SQL, and enjoy both building things and extracting insights from data. 
Know how to apply different algorithms to solve different problems — whether it is ARIMA models for forecasting or neural networks for product recommendations — and are excited to expand your comfort zone by learning new methods and diving deeper into particular subfields. 
Have a structured approach to solving both narrowly scoped and open-ended problems, with the ability to both find optimal solutions and make appropriate cost/benefit tradeoffs. 
Are able to communicate and empathize with customers and colleagues when trying to understand their problems, needs, and desires. 
Can work independently, manage your own time, and take ownership of tasks from start to finish in a dynamic environment where priorities are subject to change along the way while thriving in teams where everyone contributes their best work. 
Are eager to continuously develop, nurture and share skills through feedback and learning, together with the people around you. 
Fluency in English. 
Have a Master’s degree within a technical/engineering field or quantitative field, like computer science, physics, economics, statistics, mathematics, etc. 
Possess a strong analytical mindset, combined with creativity in the face of novel problems, and curiosity and daring when venturing into unknown territory. 
The opportunity to make a lasting mark on the daily lives of the people around you, through a product that truly contributes to their general well-being. 
A large, tight-knit Data & Insight specialist community — there are over 30 of us embedded in various teams within the company at the time of writing, and we all maintain strong ties even though we work in widely different areas! 
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development and progression in a fast-growing, ever-changing tech company with new challenges and opportunities to solve meaningful, previously unsolved problems around every corner. We make it a priority to facilitate internal promotion and mobility so you can keep growing within the company. 
Enthusiastic colleagues who truly care about supporting and helping others.

Get to know our way of working with OKR's — a framework we share with Google, Twitter, and Uber — and Flow, our own system for working within and between development teams to create value. 
A transparent workplace where we use Quip and Slack to communicate, discuss and share what we are working on, and stay in the loop with fewer e-mails and meetings. 
A culture that embraces and celebrates differences, built on tolerance, collaboration, and compassion. We actively seek to hire people with differences in education, personality, skillset, life experience, and knowledge base. 
The possibility to take stock in the success of the company.

Perform radiochemistry development for new radiopharmaceuticals through pre-clinical and clinical studies, and into commercial manufacturing. 
Develop automated manufacturing methods for the production of radiopharmaceuticals to the correct level of quality, specifications and controls according to regulatory requirements. 
Provide radiochemistry development expertise to support products across the wide development stages from early development to life cycle management. 
Write and review suitable scientific reports & documentation to support regulatory documentation packages and establishment of manufacturing. 
Perform projects with academic partners and external contract research & development organisations. 
PhD/MSc in Radiochemistry, Chemistry, Analytical Chemistry or similar or equivalent knowledge or experience. 
Hands on experience in [18F]fluoride radiolabelling techniques for small and large molecules using direct or synthon-based methods and strong scientific knowledge of the established chemistries of other radionuclides used in diagnostic radiopharmaceuticals. 
Experience with academic and/or commercial radiopharmaceutical development/production. 
Strong English communication skills. 
Organised approach for planning and delivering within complex scientific projects. 
Demonstrable practical knowledge of analytical techniques and methods used in the characterisation and release of radiopharmaceuticals. 
Understanding of regulatory requirements for development of radiopharmaceuticals. 
Experience with radiolabelling of biologically synthesised materials. 
A good track record of working with external partners. 
Experience with current Good Manufacturing Practice requirements.

company_offeredRole: Director of Data & Insight - Shop Platform
listing_jobDesc:
Provide senior leadership and contribute to strategy: Lead the Data & Insight discipline in the Shop Platform area and be one of the key people in the overall management of the Data & Insight discipline. You are also responsible for the Data & Insight strategy for this area, by ensuring strong value creation from data in the strategy, execution and impact of the teams in the Shop platform for both data science applications and insights. To do this you work with other disciplines to ensure that data science can power the product development where applicable, all the way from product ideation to amazing machine learning models running in production. 
Attract, recruit and onboard data professionals: You attract and hire the best talent, and help them get up to speed and feel welcome - regardless of whether they are straight out of school or seasoned professionals. 
Raise the bar in Data & Insight: Advocate and continuously improve all skills related to Data & Insight indirectly through leads and managers in your platform area. Develop a team culture, routines, standards and systems that encourages Data Scientist and Data Analysts to help and push each other to be better.
 Enable our data professionals to grow: You set expectations, enhance motivation, give feedback and support in the development of each data professional either directly or indirectly by building up and leading other managers. You are an inspiring leader and a great mentor as well as being flexible and capable of leading by example if necessary. 
Create the conditions for value creation from data: Ensure that data professionals have what they need to do their best possible work, be it tools, materials, space, lack of distractions, stakeholder management, time for experimentation or research, training, inspiration, or advocacy. You also make sure we catch opportunities for collaboration across platform areas and teams, and contribute to the continuous improvement of our Data & Insight discipline. 
Give back and share: Ensure that we actively share learnings and opinions with others around us both internally and externally via our blog on Medium, talks and other relevant forums, and in particular around your discipline and its solution areas. 
The opportunity to leave a lasting mark and impression on the daily lives of the people around you, through a product that truly contributes to their general well-being. 
A large, tight-knit Data & Insight specialist community — there are 35 of us in various teams within the company at the time of writing, and we all maintain strong ties even though we work in widely different areas! 
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development and progression in a fast growing, ever-changing tech company with new challenges and opportunities to solve meaningful, previously unsolved problems around every corner. We make it a priority to facilitate internal promotion and mobility so you can keep growing within the company. 
Enthusiastic colleagues who truly care about helping others. 
An onboarding program where all new employees get to work hands-on in delivery, picking, replenishment and customer service — in addition to our Data & Insight-specific onboarding. 
Get to know our way of working with OKR's— a framework we share with Google, Twitter and Uber — and Flow, our own system for working within and between development teams to create value. 
A transparent workplace where we use Quip and Slack to communicate, discuss and share what we are working on, and stay on the loop with less e-mails and meetings. 
Possibility to invest in private company stock options. 
Help with relocation provided if your favorite option is Oslo or Berlin, alternatively we will be open to discuss a remote setup in compatible time zones. Travel, once permitted, will however be required. 
Proven experience as a leader and as a manager of data professionals, ideally across multiple teams, within analytical disciplines, including recruitment and building up teams. 
Passionate about creating a great data and insight culture.
 Experience working hands-on as in analytical roles, such as data engineer, data analyst or data scientist, in a modern product & tech company. 
Know how to set and align on a great strategy where data is a key component, communicate it effectively and execute on it across several teams and areas. 
Know how to organise analytical roles and teams in a way that secures great impact, balances autonomy with alignment, and really engages people — you’ve tried different models and know what works and when. 
Manage a large and varied set of stakeholders across a big organization. 
Open to travel from time-to-time and capable of leading remote teams as effectively as those on-site with you. 
aMaster’s degree or higher within a technical and/or quantitative field, such as computer science, mathematics, statistics, physics or economics. 
Proven track record of attracting and recruiting skilled talent in the Data & Insight Discipline, and enabling them to be great. 
Experienced in working on data enablement for customer focused cross-functional teams. 
Speak and write fluently in English (additional languages is a plus).

A strong analytical mindset is important in this role, combined with creativity in the face of novel problems, curiosity and daring when venturing into unknown territory. We want all employees to have empathy for customers and colleagues when trying to understand their problems, needs and desires. You are pragmatic when needed, and enjoy a dynamic everyday life where priorities and needs change. You are also a lifelong learner — we are big on sharing knowledge.
