The opportunity to leave a lasting mark and impression on the daily lives of the people around you, through a product that truly contributes to their general well-being. 
A large, tight-knit Data & Insight specialist community — there are 35 of us in various teams within the company at the time of writing, and we all maintain strong ties even though we work in widely different areas! 
Excellent opportunities for personal and professional development and progression in a fast growing, ever-changing tech company with new challenges and opportunities to solve meaningful, previously unsolved problems around every corner. We make it a priority to facilitate internal promotion and mobility so you can keep growing within the company. 
Enthusiastic colleagues who truly care about helping others. 
An onboarding program where all new employees get to work hands-on in delivery, picking, replenishment and customer service — in addition to our Data & Insight-specific onboarding. 
Get to know our way of working with OKR's— a framework we share with Google, Twitter and Uber — and Flow, our own system for working within and between development teams to create value. 
A transparent workplace where we use Quip and Slack to communicate, discuss and share what we are working on, and stay on the loop with less e-mails and meetings. 
Possibility to invest in private company stock options. 
Help with relocation provided if your favorite option is Oslo or Berlin, alternatively we will be open to discuss a remote setup in compatible time zones. Travel, once permitted, will however be required. 
Proven experience as a leader and as a manager of data professionals, ideally across multiple teams, within analytical disciplines, including recruitment and building up teams. 
Passionate about creating a great data and insight culture.
 Experience working hands-on as in analytical roles, such as data engineer, data analyst or data scientist, in a modern product & tech company. 
Know how to set and align on a great strategy where data is a key component, communicate it effectively and execute on it across several teams and areas. 
Know how to organise analytical roles and teams in a way that secures great impact, balances autonomy with alignment, and really engages people — you’ve tried different models and know what works and when. 
Manage a large and varied set of stakeholders across a big organization. 
Open to travel from time-to-time and capable of leading remote teams as effectively as those on-site with you. 
Master’s degree or higher within a technical and/or quantitative field, such as computer science, mathematics, statistics, physics or economics. 
Proven track record of attracting and recruiting skilled talent in the Data & Insight Discipline, and enabling them to be great. 
Experienced in working on data enablement for customer focused cross-functional teams. 
Speak and write fluently in English (additional languages is a plus).

Build, scale, and maintain data products based on machine learning, optimization, and other types of algorithms on Google Cloud Platform. We run all of this in containers on Kubernetes under the hood, but as a data scientist, you should only need to know how to write Python code to get your stuff into production! 
Develop and deploy your own data pipelines with feature engineering, model training, and whatever else you need to get the job done. We use Argo Workflows to run all of our Python pipelines in containers, and dbt to run everything SQL on our Snowflake data warehouse. 
Work with product managers, data analysts, business representatives, and other stakeholders to understand their problems and design clever algorithmic solutions, and make sure we properly define success for improvements, establish baselines, and measure effects. 
Perform complex data analysis, communicate insights tailored to different audiences, and make recommendations based on your findings that contribute to company strategic decisions. We strive to preach and practice decision intelligence in organizational decision-making, and as a member of Data & Insight, you play a key role in these efforts.

Can work independently, manage your own time, and take ownership of tasks from start to finish in a dynamic environment where priorities are subject to change along the way while thriving in teams where everyone contributes their best work. 
Are eager to continuously develop, nurture and share skills through feedback and learning, together with the people around you. 
Fluency in English. 
Have a Master’s degree within a technical/engineering field or quantitative field, like computer science, physics, economics, statistics, mathematics, etc. 
Possess a strong analytical mindset, combined with creativity in the face of novel problems, and curiosity and daring when venturing into unknown territory.

Department of Computer Science, Parks Road, Oxford.Research Software EngineerFull-time, flexible options considered (e.g. part-time, job share)Fixed-term for up to 12 monthsGrade 7: £32,817 - £40,322 p.a.The Oxford Research Software Engineering Group (OxRSE - www.rse.ox.ac.uk) is looking to recruit a Research Software Engineer (RSE) to join our team. We work with other research groups across the University of Oxford to create, improve and maintain software used for scientific research and translational projects, as well as providing consulting and training to other researchers on best practices in software development and reproducible research.This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing team and work as an RSE on a diverse selection of world-leading and impactful projects. Some of our past / current projects include Global.health (https://global.health): an improved, scalable platform for disease tracking created by an international team of researchers from leading institutions such as Oxford, Harvard and the Boston Children’s hospital; PyBaMM (www.pybamm.org), a library for solving PDE models of batteries with a core development team from Oxford, Michigan, Warwick, UCL and Imperial; and LanguageScreen (languagescreen.com) a key tool for the Nuffield Early Language Intervention (NELI) programme and part of the COVID-19 catch up package offered by the Department for Education to primary schools in England.We offer new recruits the potential to advance their career and to make a significant contribution to the development of good software practices at a world-leading university. You will work on a variety of world-class research projects across the University of Oxford, deliver workshops and training in software development best practices, and further develop your own technical and research skills as well as those outside of software development, such as project management and consultancy.We are looking for candidates with a doctoral degree with a significant computational component, who have had experience developing software in a research setting and who are able to collaborate effectively with other researchers in order to design and implement reliable and maintainable software solutions to pressing scientific questions. You must be able to rapidly acquire skills in new programming languages, libraries and platforms, but any prior experience working with data science, machine learning or databases would be highly desirable, as would any experience designing or delivering training courses.This post in the first instance is a fixed-term 12 month position.The closing date for applications is 12 noon on 30th August 2021.Our staff and students come from all over the world and we proudly promote a friendly and inclusive culture. Diversity is positively encouraged, through diversity groups and champions, for example http://www.cs.ox.ac.uk/aboutus/women-cs-oxford/index.html, as well as a number of family-friendly policies, such as the right to apply for flexible working and support for staff returning from periods of extended absence, for example maternity leave.For further details and to apply please visit:https://my.corehr.com/pls/uoxrecruit/erq_jobspec_version_4.display_form?p_company=10&p_internal_external=E&p_display_in_irish=N&p_process_type=&p_applicant_no=&p_form_profile_detail=&p_display_apply_ind=Y&p_refresh_search=Y&p_recruitment_id=152822Apply Now!Show more

Job DescriptionAt Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.An exciting opportunity has become available to join Boeing Defence UK as a Simulation Engineer to support simulation and software development programmes.About the roleWe are seeking an associate Software Engineer to support Defence and Security domains at Boeing locations and Customer sites across the UK, including Autonomous Systems, C4ISR Systems, Training and Simulation, Cyber, Space, Intelligence and Security.As a consequence of our growing business we have a number of exciting career opportunities within our Mission Systems Engineering Capability, which is responsible for the Research and Development of Advanced Technology and the Design, Development and Certification of our Mission Systems and Sub-Systems.You will join a rapidly growing Engineering Capability with a culture for development, collaboration and success. Initially you will be assigned to our Simulation Programmes, which operate across the Air, Land and Maritime domains, with future opportunity to develop your interests across the breadth of the culture and strong emphasis on openness, collaboration, innovation, safety and first time quality.What we are looking forTo be successful you will have an appreciation of simulation software and systems engineering principals as well as experience working as part of a team to deliver technology-based products.You will be a passionate and collaborative engineer eager to work in an agile and diverse engineering capability ideally with a degree or equivalent qualification in a relevant engineering or scientific field, as well as:Essential experience in:Experience developing software A hands-on Lead Engineer who spends time focusing on product alignment, technical alignment, and people, as well as coding. Software Engineers who help with business analysis, writing tests and code, and operating the components that the team owns. Building high coverage for Codat's API across third-party software platforms. This includes building data formats into our financial data standard. Reliably and quickly processing huge amounts of financial data into our data cache and query engine. Building additional products on top of our core API to unlock the power of our clients' data, through the movement of data between sources, or data visualisation. Best in class monitoring and operations tools to allow both ourselves and our clients to find, and fix, data issues early. We use a mix of technologies at Codat, but most are services supplied by Azure and leveraged using C#, we like engineers that like to keep up to date with C# and have an interest in design patterns. Our apps work extensively with the .NET web stack and knowledge of ASP.NET and REST APIs is really helpful. Clear and concise communicators; we expect Engineers to collaborate with other team members, including developers, quality assurance engineers and product stakeholders outside of Engineering. We have a passion for testing and working with frameworks like XUnit (or similar) to do behaviour and data driven unit tests. We really like engineers that are self-motivated, have a logical and systematic approach to problems solving, but understand things work best when we work as a team, are approachable, open minded, and patient. A lot of the problems we solve at Codat are about standardising data from various sources, this is a different set of problems to many software businesses, and we really like engineers who enjoy working with data and puzzling out problems that may not be obviously solved. A good head for financial systems helps, but isn’t necessary. We're a young brand located on the Isle of Wight who love what we do and as a fast growth company, there's always something new happening. We’re looking for people who love code and are ready to take their skills to the next level in a professional engineering team.Technology is at the heart of what we do. We are world leaders in on-demand garment print technology, hosting custom web stores for tens of thousands of brands and fulfilling their orders from our network of automated, print-on-demand factories across the UK. This is only possible because of our team of hard-working, passionate developers who build things that have never been built before.We grow fast and people quickly progress, so we pick our team carefully. We are all focused and take what we do seriously, whilst considering ourselves the special forces of sustainable fashion. We work hard, but we like having fun too. On team days, going surfing is pretty much a whole-squad operation.We're welcoming, friendly and we don't care if you've not got much experience. We'll challenge you to be your best, to step up, and we'll build your confidence by trusting you to take on big projects - sometimes they're things that have never been done before.For the best, there's opportunities to progress - nearly all of our management team are former apprentices or graduate trainees and our training is designed to create future leaders.Our trainee software engineering program takes confident coders, either self-taught or qualified graduates, and teaches them how to use their skills to make an impact as a professional engineer. Learning doesn't stop there - those who make the most of this opportunity are trained to take leadership responsibilities in the fast-growing team.Working in this team involves the use of PHP, MySQL, HTML, CSS & Javascript. We use the Laravel and Vue.js frameworks. We don't require any previous professional work experience for this role, but we do require that the successful applicant has good code experience, ideally in the aforementioned programming languages & frameworks.Teemill is well known for its high growth, fast track and exciting programming careers. The successful applicant will join a growing team of both full-time and trainee software engineers who are friendly, helpful and all working towards making the Teemill platform the best in the world.Essential requirements for this role: a passion for code, with examples of projects (ideally in PHP & Javascript), a positive, can-do attitude a strong desire to learn and the ability to work from our Freshwater site on the Isle of Wight.If you are a confident coder and are interested in joining an exciting high-growth startup, we'd love to hear from you.Show more

Working at Critical Software is more than just a job: here, you can really make a difference.

We’re on a mission to make the world a better and safer place, just like real superheroes. We build rock-solid software for leading industries’ most critical applications, so every line of code we write and every idea we think of can affect the lives of millions.

Now, we are looking for exceptional Junior Software Engineers to embrace this mission.

Are you finishing your academic degree? Or do you have less than two years’ worth of professional experience in software development? Then it's time to join our team of superheroes and start your professional career at Critical Software!


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

To become part of a software development team in a real-life challenging project

To participate in all project development cycle phases, with a primary focus on the implementation phase

To participate in training sessions in order to build strong technical skills

The Oxford Research Software Engineering Group (OxRSE - www.rse.ox.ac.uk) is looking to recruit a Research Software Engineer (RSE) to join our team. We work with other research groups across the University of Oxford to create, improve and maintain software used for scientific research and translational projects, as well as providing consulting and training to other researchers on best practices in software development and reproducible research.

This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing team and work as an RSE on a diverse selection of world-leading and impactful projects. Some of our past / current projects include Global.health (https://global.health): an improved, scalable platform for disease tracking created by an international team of researchers from leading institutions such as Oxford, Harvard and the Boston Children’s hospital; PyBaMM (www.pybamm.org), a library for solving PDE models of batteries with a core development team from Oxford, Michigan, Warwick, UCL and Imperial; and LanguageScreen (languagescreen.com) a key tool for the Nuffield Early Language Intervention (NELI) programme and part of the COVID-19 catch up package offered by the Department for Education to primary schools in England.

We offer new recruits the potential to advance their career and to make a significant contribution to the development of good software practices at a world-leading university. You will work on a variety of world-class research projects across the University of Oxford, deliver workshops and training in software development best practices, and further develop your own technical and research skills as well as those outside of software development, such as project management and consultancy.

We are looking for candidates with a doctoral degree with a significant computational component, who have had experience developing software in a research setting and who are able to collaborate effectively with other researchers in order to design and implement reliable and maintainable software solutions to pressing scientific questions. You must be able to rapidly acquire skills in new programming languages, libraries and platforms, but any prior experience working with data science, machine learning or databases would be highly desirable, as would any experience designing or delivering training courses.

This post in the first instance is a fixed-term 12 month position.
The closing date for applications is 12 noon on 30th August 2021.
Our staff and students come from all over the world and we proudly promote a friendly and inclusive culture. Diversity is positively encouraged, through diversity groups and champions, for example http://www.cs.ox.ac.uk/aboutus/women-cs-oxford/index.html, as well as a number of family-friendly policies, such as the right to apply for flexible working and support for staff returning from periods of extended absence, for example maternity leave.Show more

The Software Engineer will be part of the Digital Research team within Bodleian Digital Library Systems and Services. The Digital Library supports and develops tools and services to further the teaching, learning, and research objectives of Bodleian Libraries and the wider University of Oxford.

The Digital Research team develops a variety of tools and services, including our flagship platform for the delivery of digitised collections, Digital Bodleian, and a number of discovery tools that enable researchers to find and access the riches of the Bodleian’s Special Collections. The team utilises a number of technologies and standards including the International Image Interoperability Framework (IIIF), TEI, and EAD metadata standards.

Applicants for this position must have a demonstrably strong technical background. Applicants with experience in cultural heritage institutions, arts and humanities, or digital humanities are especially welcome. A portfolio of past work, preferably published with commit histories on GitHub, should be provided with the application.

This post is fixed-term for 2-years, working 37.5 hours per week.

Only applications received online before 12:00 midday (GMT/BST) on Wednesday 18 August 2021 can be considered. Interviews are expected to take place during the week commencing 6 September 2021.Show more

We are the Places for People Group; we are placemakers; our work impacts on the lives of people across the U.K. – providing homes to live in, communities to retire to, spaces to stay active, supported homes for independent living, and student accommodation. Our places work when they work for everyone.

How do we do all this? By surrounding ourselves with innovative people, creative people and forward thinking people. Our people live and breathe our SPIRIT values; we are the place for spirited people.

So, we want you to join us and the 12,000 other colleagues on our journey; colleagues who have helped us create places, maintain 209,000 homes, manage £4.5 billion of assets, deliver £87.9m in social value and teach 80,000 children to swim each week.

More about your role

It's an exciting time to join the team, with opportunities to work with Artificial Intelligence, Cognitive Services and Machine Learning. Our technology teams are empowered to bring new ideas to the table and to help shape our technology stack. As we have adopted a multi cloud strategy (Azure/AWS), the scope to learn new/additional skills will be never ending.

The Senior Software Engineer will technically develop web based solutions for the Group, improving the consumer's (Employees, customers, clients) experience. The role will ensure successful delivery of projects through the use of the .Net stack, Angular/React and Umbraco while helping to shape our microservice strategy, while working closely within an enthusiastic and talented team.

The post holder will continually identify and explore opportunities for innovative technologies and new ways of working that they can put in practice to help support delivery of the Group's ambitions.

More about you

With experience working within a large complex organisation you will in a previous role have built and designed commercial web platforms. You will have an in-depth knowledge of web based technologies and programming languages, including UMBRACO 7 and above as well as a good knowledge and standard of front-end technologies; semantic HTML, CSS/Sass, JS, Angular, React and Node.

The position relies on a good analytical approach to problem solving with excellent attention to detail. Excellent communication skills, both written and oral, are essential as you will be dealing with staff at all levels of the organisation to provide verbal and documented responses of both a technical and non-technical nature.

The benefits

Our ambition gives you all the challenge you could wish for and that's why we can offer you tangible and exciting career progression in a diverse and pioneering business.

Here people can flourish, thrive, better themselves and work in fantastic communities with inspirational colleagues and customers.

We know that there's always more we can do to make you smile, that's why we offer a comprehensive benefits package to help colleagues save money or make their lives a little bit easier; from a pension, generous holiday pay, training, sick pay, and free or discounted gym membership – to a wealth of extra perks including discounts and offers on thousands of retailers, restaurants and leisure outlets and much more.Show more

Work as a software engineer in one of our multidisciplinary agile teams to develop the back-end of our digital products. This could be either on customer or business-facing products, or on our internal systems. Collaborate on the design and implementation of a typical project, from start to finish. Improve engineering practices inside and outside of your team. Continue to learn and develop your skills as an engineer. Share your knowledge with other members of your team. Settle into a product team, work on existing features, deliver code towards features on our product roadmap to help meet company goals! Gain an understanding of our business, our customers, and our domain, allowing you to use your judgement to help your team make decisions. Break down projects into individual tasks, prioritising and planning as needed. Implement different types of testing. Create documentation, and extend our services to self-document themselves where possible. Play an active role in our code review process, reviewing code from across the team as well as making it easy for others to review the code you write. Pitch in with discovery, ideation and research alongside designers, engineers and user researchers to identify, prioritise, solve problems iteratively. Share your knowledge/experience/interests with the team – be it through pairing or an engineering team demo. Have end to end responsibility for delivery of functionality through development, testing and deployment into live Our applications are mainly written in Java, with RESTful API style by default using SpringBoot v2, primarily deployed to AWS on EKS. Our databases are a mixture of Aurora, MongoDB, DynamoDB, Marklogic, Oracle and MySql and we use Redis, and SQS. We have a microservices approach and work alongside our DEVOPS team to roll these out to the cloud using CI/CD pipelines We use SONR for code quality, Datadog for centralised logging and monitoring. Our standards continue to evolve as technology does, and the team of Engineers at Yell that you will work alongside, strive to continuously improve our systems and methods for delivery. You’ll be able to jump in and work with a mix of our backend technologies - SpringBoot and MongoDB/Aurora/SQS You’ve worked with non-functional requirements such as performance, usability, and security, and consider these in your work. You’ve worked within a mid-level equivalent software engineering role in a web-based space and feel comfortable leading on typical projects. Your communication skills mean you can communicate well with a range of people, including when we’re working remotely. You’ve worked in an agile environment on a scrum or Kanban team Some extra skills that would be great: You’ve previously worked on a Growth team (or a similarly focused team) and have got some knowledge of technologies in this space (e.g. working with SpringBoot, Node, MongoDB), worked on web-based business tools, or on products similar to ours. You’ve previously helped start-ups to build new products and could help us to iteratively create value for our customers. You’ve got a knowledge of similar problem spaces or industries. You care about creating inclusive and diverse environments. Mentoring or sponsorship of other engineers is important to you. If this sounds like what you’d love to be doing, we can’t wait to hear from you. Be creative, don't be afraid to bring your ideas to the table - you will always be heard! You are full-stack (or close to it!) You look at the full picture to understand the value and impact of what you are building by talking to customers & working with the product team You are the Nancy Drew of data and analysis. You thrive on building what users and clients actually need... not just what they want! (sometimes people confuse the two!) You believe in team spirit - not competition. We are a very autonomous environment, and whilst we will give you all the tools and support that you need to be successful, we need someone with the knowledge of what it takes to operate in that environment, with minimal hand-holding. But hey, if you're under this and you know you've got what it takes - send us a message! Adept at least one modern web/mobile framework. We have team members everywhere, from Cornwall to Glasgow - we place an emphasis on finding the right people in any location, not any people in the right location. We are committed to internal progression, and offering our team members the best opportunities for growth. We want to invest in you the same way you're going to invest in us! We want everyone to achieve "zen mastery" with a free subscription to Calm — work can be stressful (we know!) and we want to help you switch off And the best benefit of all... A propos de Crédit Agricole Corporate and Investment Bank (Crédit Agricole CIB) Crédit Agricole CIB est la banque de financement et d'investissement du groupe Crédit Agricole, 12e groupe bancaire mondial par les fonds propres Tier1 (The Banker, juillet 2020). Près de 8400 collaborateurs en Europe, Amériques, Asie-Pacifique, Moyen-Orient et Afrique, accompagnent les clients de la Banque dans la couverture de leurs besoins financiers à travers le monde. Crédit Agricole CIB propose à ses clients grandes entreprises et institutionnels une gamme de produits et services dans les métiers de la banque de marchés, de la banque d'investissement, des financements structurés, de la banque commerciale et du commerce international. Pionnier dans le domaine de la finance Climat, la Banque occupe aujourd'hui une position de leader sur ce segment avec une offre complète pour l'ensemble de ses clients. The culture: As a leading beauty retailer, backed by the LVMH luxury brand, our reach is broad, and our impact is global. Yet there’s always room to explore. It’s in our DNA to innovate and, at Sephora, all 40,000 passionate team members are united by a common goal - to reimagine the future of beauty. You can unleash your creativity, because we’ve got disruptive spirit. You can learn and evolve, because we empower you to be your best. You can be yourself, because you are what sets us apart. This is the future of beauty. Reimagine your future, at Sephora.

A propos de Crédit Agricole Corporate and Investment Bank (Crédit Agricole CIB) Crédit Agricole CIB est la banque de financement et d'investissement du groupe Crédit Agricole, 12e groupe bancaire mondial par les fonds propres Tier1 (The Banker, juillet 2020). Près de 8400 collaborateurs en Europe, Amériques, Asie-Pacifique, Moyen-Orient et Afrique, accompagnent les clients de la Banque dans la couverture de leurs besoins financiers à travers le monde. Crédit Agricole CIB propose à ses clients grandes entreprises et institutionnels une gamme de produits et services dans les métiers de la banque de marchés, de la banque d'investissement, des financements structurés, de la banque commerciale et du commerce international. Pionnier dans le domaine de la finance Climat, la Banque occupe aujourd'hui une position de leader sur ce segment avec une offre complète pour l'ensemble de ses clients. Job Description
Rockwell Automation, the world's largest company dedicated to industrial automation, employs about 22,000 individuals globally, makes its customers more productive and the world more sustainable. Throughout the world, our flagship Allen-Bradley® and Rockwell Software® product brands are recognized for innovation and excellence, and serves customers in more than 80 countries worldwide.When you choose Rockwell Automation, you join talented employees who have helped us establish our leadership position in the automation industry over the past century.You join a diverse, inclusive and global community with a passion for innovation. A place where you can partner with great minds and inspiring people.As much as we focus on our customers, we know our employees are key to our success and future. Helping you develop a rewarding career is a top priority. Because when you succeed, we succeed.As a Software Engineer for Rockwell Automation, you will have the opportunity to design and develop industry-leading commercial software, known for its innovation and usability. You will also be responsible for performing basic software testing tasks including, but not limited to, test development, planning, scheduling, and execution. In this position, you will be highly involved in subsystem design, implementation, and testing, working very closely with the support of our senior engineers. You will play an active role in all the stages of the development lifecycle and support your team throughout the process. You will also help ensure that developed products meet requirements and are within total quality management standards. This position will allow you to collaborate with multiple global cross-functional teams. When you join our software engineering group, you become part of a team that believes in knowledge sharing and collaboration and that is committed to using reliable and well-thought-out engineering practices and technology to overcome any challenges. We are looking for someone who will effectively leverage and learn from a diverse set of technical backgrounds and opinions by fostering a team-oriented environment and the use of open and direct communications, honesty and respect. The ideal candidate will also actively seek knowledge of new developments in the software engineering, computer engineering, and test automation fields and will identify and pursue career development and training opportunities. The candidate should be an experienced professional with a full understanding of area of specialization and an ability to resolve wide range of issues in creative and effective ways. This role reports to the Software Engineering Manager and is located in Colombia What you will do - Independently gathers and documents requirements for a feature and its components, ensuring the information required for the development of software and corresponding test cases are contained in the specifications. - Participates in architectural design and independently develops system designs that meet the requirements. Provides estimates for the design. Considers tradeoffs between requirements, speed, cost and reliability in the choice of a design approach. - Implements and documents code that meets the requirements of the software design. - Leads or participates in reviews of documents, designs, code, test cases and user documentation. - Builds relationships and interacts with peers to ensure assigned tasks are prioritized appropriately. - Thinks outside the box and is willing to research and explore new avenues to overcome obstacles by utilizing the latest technologies and standards. May function as a go-to person for a technology, software methodology, or other area of expertise. - Takes the lead on identifying and recommending software development capability improvements in the areas of software development practices and development tools. Minimal qualifications - Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent - At least 8 years of experience in a software product development environmentPreferred qualifications - Experience in large, scalable distributed systems and/or SaaS solutions - Software development on Cloud and Mobile platforms - Object orientated design using C++, C#, or Java - Proficiency in TypeScript, Node.js, Angular framework, GraphQL - One or more of the following – High availability, performance and scalability, micro services, SOA, modern database architectures, highly automated test systems, rapid prototyping, demonstrable experience of taking concept to product, Web technologies, security, data communication, and contemporary user interface technologies - Software development on both Windows and Linux - Direct experience with design patterns and architecting modular software - Direct experience with the Industrial Automation industry is desired - Direct experience collaborating with local and global technical development teams - Strong interpersonal and English communication (verbal and written)Show more

Job Description
We Believe in Better!
We are a global information technology company that builds high-performance, security-centric solutions that can help change the world. Enhancing people’s lives through secure, reliable advanced technology is our vision.
At Unisys, we believe in better! Here, you have the opportunity to learn new skills, apply your expertise, and solve complex problems with cutting edge technologies and solutions. You are part of a global diverse team that supports you, drives change, and delivers successful results consistently.
Our associates are at the forefront of everything we do, driving our clients’ successes while giving back to communities and making this world a safer and more secure place to live and work. Our success is a direct result of the work of our people who live and breathe our Core Beliefs. Simply put, we believe in better lives. Join us!
Learn more about Unisys and our key solution offerings: Unisys, Stealth™, CloudForte®, InteliServe™
What success looks like in this role:
The majority of the work activities are performed in a highly–directed environment. Assignments include repair activities such as replaceable unit swapping, image loading, and unit testing using a detailed script. Will also perform other non-troubleshooting duties. Direction is provided by script, help desk or service desk in a Next Business Day (NBD) and/or Same Business Day (SBD) service delivery environment Key Responsibilities • PLS Support for calls such as Dell Client • Transformation Services calls, installing and servicing PCs, and PC peripherals and/or electronic equipment • Takes service calls and performs incident specific activities as directed by Help Desk, Service Desk or script • May perform routine installs, moves, adds and changes as part of a directed team, including: o Complex desktop and laptop break fix work o Whole unit replacement o Simple desktop printer fixes o Load software with a script • Performs scripted image loading, unit diagnostics and replaceable unit swapping • Simple troubleshooting by running basic diagnostics and performs basic module replacement on PCs, servers and peripherals • Performs preventative maintenance activities on certain products as directed • Maintains a high degree of professionalism in actions, demeanor and dress. • Insures customer satisfaction throughout
You will be successful in this role if you have:
Key Qualifications • Requires a HS Degree and a minimum of 6 months of hands-on experience with laptop and desktop break-fix • Computer building background experience preferred. • A+ certification • Specific Manufacturers certifications as required. i.e. EMC, Dell, Cisco, Microsoft, Unisys. COMPTIA, and NETWORKPLUS • General knowledge of desktop hardware and software including basic knowledge of Microsoft applications • Basic mechanical skills and understanding of electro static discharge (ESD) procedures • Training and/or vendor certifications as required including completion of Core Training • Ability to resolve basic / non-complex problems as directed • Client and/or governmental clearance may be required

Job Description
Rockwell Automation, the world's largest company dedicated to industrial automation, employs about 22,000 individuals globally, makes its customers more productive and the world more sustainable. Throughout the world, our flagship Allen-Bradley® and Rockwell Software® product brands are recognized for innovation and excellence, and serves customers in more than 80 countries worldwide.When you choose Rockwell Automation, you join talented employees who have helped us establish our leadership position in the automation industry over the past century.You join a diverse, inclusive and global community with a passion for innovation. A place where you can partner with great minds and inspiring people.As much as we focus on our customers, we know our employees are key to our success and future. Helping you develop a rewarding career is a top priority. Because when you succeed, we succeed.As a Software Engineer for Rockwell Automation, you will have the opportunity to design and develop industry-leading commercial software, known for its innovation and usability. You will also be responsible for performing basic software testing tasks including, but not limited to, test development, planning, scheduling, and execution. In this position, you will be highly involved in subsystem design, implementation, and testing, working very closely with the support of our senior engineers. You will play an active role in all the stages of the development lifecycle and support your team throughout the process. You will also help ensure that developed products meet requirements and are within total quality management standards. This position will allow you to collaborate with multiple global cross-functional teams. When you join our software engineering group, you become part of a team that believes in knowledge sharing and collaboration and that is committed to using reliable and well-thought-out engineering practices and technology to overcome any challenges. We are looking for someone who will effectively leverage and learn from a diverse set of technical backgrounds and opinions by fostering a team-oriented environment and the use of open and direct communications, honesty and respect. The ideal candidate will also actively seek knowledge of new developments in the software engineering, computer engineering, and test automation fields and will identify and pursue career development and training opportunities. The candidate should be an experienced professional with a full understanding of area of specialization and an ability to resolve wide range of issues in creative and effective ways. This role reports to the Software Engineering Manager and is located in Colombia What you will do - Independently gathers and documents requirements for a feature and its components, ensuring the information required for the development of software and corresponding test cases are contained in the specifications. - Participates in architectural design and independently develops system designs that meet the requirements. Provides estimates for the design. Considers tradeoffs between requirements, speed, cost and reliability in the choice of a design approach. - Implements and documents code that meets the requirements of the software design. - Leads or participates in reviews of documents, designs, code, test cases and user documentation. - Builds relationships and interacts with peers to ensure assigned tasks are prioritized appropriately. - Thinks outside the box and is willing to research and explore new avenues to overcome obstacles by utilizing the latest technologies and standards. May function as a go-to person for a technology, software methodology, or other area of expertise. - Takes the lead on identifying and recommending software development capability improvements in the areas of software development practices and development tools. Minimal qualifications - Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent - At least 8 years of experience in a software product development environmentPreferred qualifications - Experience in large, scalable distributed systems and/or SaaS solutions - Software development on Cloud and Mobile platforms - Object orientated design using C++, C#, or Java - Proficiency in TypeScript, Node.js, Angular framework, GraphQL - One or more of the following – High availability, performance and scalability, micro services, SOA, modern database architectures, highly automated test systems, rapid prototyping, demonstrable experience of taking concept to product, Web technologies, security, data communication, and contemporary user interface technologies - Software development on both Windows and Linux - Direct experience with design patterns and architecting modular software - Direct experience with the Industrial Automation industry is desired - Direct experience collaborating with local and global technical development teams - Strong interpersonal and English communication (verbal and written)Show more

Job Description
Rockwell Automation, the world's largest company dedicated to industrial automation, employs about 22,000 individuals globally, makes its customers more productive and the world more sustainable. Throughout the world, our flagship Allen-Bradley® and Rockwell Software® product brands are recognized for innovation and excellence, and serves customers in more than 80 countries worldwide.When you choose Rockwell Automation, you join talented employees who have helped us establish our leadership position in the automation industry over the past century.You join a diverse, inclusive and global community with a passion for innovation. A place where you can partner with great minds and inspiring people.As much as we focus on our customers, we know our employees are key to our success and future. Helping you develop a rewarding career is a top priority. Because when you succeed, we succeed.As a Software Engineer for Rockwell Automation, you will have the opportunity to design and develop industry-leading commercial software, known for its innovation and usability. You will also be responsible for performing basic software testing tasks including, but not limited to, test development, planning, scheduling, and execution. In this position, you will be highly involved in subsystem design, implementation, and testing, working very closely with the support of our senior engineers. You will play an active role in all the stages of the development lifecycle and support your team throughout the process. You will also help ensure that developed products meet requirements and are within total quality management standards. This position will allow you to collaborate with multiple global cross-functional teams. When you join our software engineering group, you become part of a team that believes in knowledge sharing and collaboration and that is committed to using reliable and well-thought-out engineering practices and technology to overcome any challenges. We are looking for someone who will effectively leverage and learn from a diverse set of technical backgrounds and opinions by fostering a team-oriented environment and the use of open and direct communications, honesty and respect. The ideal candidate will also actively seek knowledge of new developments in the software engineering, computer engineering, and test automation fields and will identify and pursue career development and training opportunities. The candidate should be an experienced professional with a full understanding of area of specialization and an ability to resolve wide range of issues in creative and effective ways. This role reports to the Software Engineering Manager and is located in Colombia What you will do - Independently gathers and documents requirements for a feature and its components, ensuring the information required for the development of software and corresponding test cases are contained in the specifications. - Participates in architectural design and independently develops system designs that meet the requirements. Provides estimates for the design. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience. Writing production-ready feature code: Building directly on top of AWS, utilizing the full power and range of the platform to generate simple solutions that are easy to maintain Fixing defects in code written by someone else: You will focus on delivering new features, not puzzling with old broken ones. Wasting your time in meetings and administrative tasks: We have automated most of the overhead so that your day can be centered around the thing you love most: coding. Building new product features and capabilities: You will be a critical contributor in transforming our portfolio of 100+ products to cloud-native applications.
 Learning different technologies, databases, and languages: We want to play an essential role in your growth towards becoming an experienced senior developer. We hope you are as thrilled about your career outlook as we are! 3+ years of coding experience in Java, JavaScript, C#, or C++ for a software service or product. Ability to understand and pick up new technologies: We are not looking for expertise in any specific technology, rather your willingness to learn them Ability to work 100% remotely Start by hitting the Apply button on Indeed and this will redirect you to crossover.com. Once there, you will have to create your job application by clicking the Apply Now button and providing your contact details. Doing that will get you an account on crossover.com which allows you to go through the assessment process anytime, at your own convenience. It's all online and self-paced! Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.

Job Description
We Believe in Better!
We are a global information technology company that builds high-performance, security-centric solutions that can help change the world. Enhancing people’s lives through secure, reliable advanced technology is our vision.
At Unisys, we believe in better! Here, you have the opportunity to learn new skills, apply your expertise, and solve complex problems with cutting edge technologies and solutions. You are part of a global diverse team that supports you, drives change, and delivers successful results consistently.
Our associates are at the forefront of everything we do, driving our clients’ successes while giving back to communities and making this world a safer and more secure place to live and work. Our success is a direct result of the work of our people who live and breathe our Core Beliefs. Simply put, we believe in better lives. Join us!
Learn more about Unisys and our key solution offerings: Unisys, Stealth™, CloudForte®, InteliServe™
What success looks like in this role:
The majority of the work activities are performed in a highly–directed environment. Assignments include repair activities such as replaceable unit swapping, image loading, and unit testing using a detailed script. Will also perform other non-troubleshooting duties. Direction is provided by script, help desk or service desk in a Next Business Day (NBD) and/or Same Business Day (SBD) service delivery environment Key Responsibilities • PLS Support for calls such as Dell Client • Transformation Services calls, installing and servicing PCs, and PC peripherals and/or electronic equipment • Takes service calls and performs incident specific activities as directed by Help Desk, Service Desk or script • May perform routine installs, moves, adds and changes as part of a directed team, including: o Complex desktop and laptop break fix work o Whole unit replacement o Simple desktop printer fixes o Load software with a script • Performs scripted image loading, unit diagnostics and replaceable unit swapping • Simple troubleshooting by running basic diagnostics and performs basic module replacement on PCs, servers and peripherals • Performs preventative maintenance activities on certain products as directed • Maintains a high degree of professionalism in actions, demeanor and dress. • Insures customer satisfaction throughout
You will be successful in this role if you have:
Key Qualifications • Requires a HS Degree and a minimum of 6 months of hands-on experience with laptop and desktop break-fix • Computer building background experience preferred. • A+ certification • Specific Manufacturers certifications as required. i.e. EMC, Dell, Cisco, Microsoft, Unisys. COMPTIA, and NETWORKPLUS • General knowledge of desktop hardware and software including basic knowledge of Microsoft applications • Basic mechanical skills and understanding of electro static discharge (ESD) procedures • Training and/or vendor certifications as required including completion of Core Training • Ability to resolve basic / non-complex problems as directed • Client and/or governmental clearance may be required

Mit Freude berätst du Partner, Verantwortliche oder Spezialisten bei der Integration und Überführung von Applikationen oder Services in der Cloud. Dein Einsatz in Projekten für eine erfolgreiche Umsetzung der Cloud-Story rundet dein Aufgabengebiet ab. Du verfügst über Cloud-Kenntnisse bei AWS und/oder Azure und kannst Erfahrungen im Bereich Architektur, Netzwerk und Security vorweisen. Du bist mit Terraform (Infrastructure as Code) vertraut und kannst die Kenntnisse auch weitergeben. Connectivity Themen von AWS direct Connect und/oder Azure ExpressRoute sowie die Cloud-internen Netzwerk-Themen (Routing, Subnetze, VPC etc.) sind dir bekannt. Automatisierung ist dabei das A und O und bereitet dir entsprechende Freude. Du bist engagiert, liebst Herausforderungen und fühlst dich sicher in agilen Umgebungen.

company_offeredRole: GCP QA & Test Engineer – Software Development Quality Assurance
listing_jobDesc: Work with cross-functional, global teams to ensure quality throughout the software development lifecycle. Participate in reviews of the software design and provide feedback on requirements and design. Analyze and understand requirements and business processes to develop robust test cases. Execute test cases, analyze test results, log and resolve issues, and create defect reports as needed. Ensure validation documentation meets regulatory expectations and company quality requirements. Ensure requirements traceability to ensure full test coverage for the software system. Identify and help resolve issues throughout the development lifecycle to ensure the project stays on track and deadlines are met. Assist in the development of new standard operating procedures and work instructions as needed to comply with regulatory requirements and expectations related to computerized systems and data integrity (e.g. ICH E6 R2, 21 CFR Part 11, FDA Guidance for Industries) Assist in implementing the Quality Management System (QMS) for software systems developed, deployed, managed, and supported by the Innovation Lab. Represent the unique value proposition of the Innovation Lab to Clinical Development and other key stakeholders throughout the company. Undergraduate degree in Computer Science / Information Systems or a related field. Minimum 5 years of experience in biotech/pharmaceutical industry in a GxP-regulated environment. Strong knowledge of GxP regulations related to computerized systems and data integrity (e.g. ICH E6 R2, 21 CFR Part 11, FDA Guidance for Industries) Familiar with Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodologies, particularly Agile. Sense of ownership and pride in your performance and its impact on the success of the company. Strong attention to detail. Strong critical thinking, analyzing, and problem-solving skills. Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously. Ability to work remotely in a fast-paced environment with little supervision. Good time management skills, ability to work under pressure. Excellent team player. Exceptional verbal and written English language skills applied to the development of detailed technical documentation. Must be able to take direction and be willing to learn and apply new concepts.

In einem eingespielten Projektteam übernimmst Du die Testautomation. Du definierst Testfälle und führst diese direkt am System aus. Du lernst mit dem Testautomation Tool (Java / Python) zu arbeiten, erstellst Tests und bist für deren Ausführung und Wartung verantwortlich. Du unterstützt das Team der Fachtester nach Bedarf und trägst zu einem stabilen System bei. Zu Deinen Stärken gehören Neugier, Offenheit und Verantwortungsbewusstsein. Du bist kommunikativ und arbeitest gerne in einem Team. Du hast erste Erfahrungen im Bereich Software-Testing gemacht und möchtest Dich in diesem Gebiet weiterentwickeln. Du bringst die Bereitschaft mit, Neues zu lernen und vertieftes Wissen aufzubauen. Gute Deutschkenntnisse werden vorausgesetzt. Gute Englisch Kenntnisse runden Dein Profil ab.

Du arbeitest gern mit Daten und deren Interpretation, hast obendrein Spass an der Entwicklung qualitativ hochstehender BI-Systeme.Teamarbeit macht dich automatisch besser, du überzeugst durch deine kommunikativen Fähigkeiten, deine hohe Dienstleistungsorientierung und ein konstruktives Auftreten. Du bist lösungsorientiert und analytisch unterwegs, denkst innovativ wie unternehmerisch, setzt dich engagiert ein, um im Miteinander begeisternde Ergebnisse zu erreichen.Baloise Kultur ist ein ausgeprägter Lernwille! Der Mainframe ist deine Welt? Dann bist du bei uns richtig.Was dich erwartetDu betreust die komplexen Verarbeitungen im Host-Umfeld und sorgst für ihre Stabilität und entwickelst sie weiter. Weil wir nah beim Kunden sind. So nah wie man das als IT'ler vielleicht von einem Versicherer nicht erwartet. Wir bekommen direktes Feedback und können unsere Software nutzergerecht optimieren. Du bekommst auch genug Challenge im Team. Wenn du also Spass hast an Austausch, Diskussion und gemeinsamer Entwicklung bist du hier richtig.Was du bekommstFlexible Arbeitszeiten sind bei der Baloise inklusive. Anstatt eines Motivationsschreibens bitten wir Dich die Fragen im Bewerbungsprozess zu beantworten.Was wir erwartenSei neugierig, hab den Antrieb, dich weiterzubilden und nutze die Möglichkeiten. Es gibt regelmässig Fortbildungsangebote auf Konferenzen und Kursen, die dich und damit die Baloise weiterbringen. Ein grosses Plus bei der Baloise ist, dass wir in einem agilen Umfeld teamübergreifend und kollegial zusammenarbeiten. Das stärkt das Netzwerk und das Miteinander.Wir sind ein Bereich, in dem man sich gegenseitig unterstützt. Keiner muss allein ins kalte Wasser springen. Dennoch solltest du, um für diese Aufgaben optimal vorbereitet zu sein, Erfahrung in der PLI Programmierung mitbringen und mit dem Aufbau von Regressionstest vertraut sein. Kenntnisse mit DB2, JCL sowie in der File-Verarbeitung setzen wir ebenfalls voraus. Über C-Kenntnisse würden wir uns freuen. Zudem hast du Erfahrung mit allen Tätigkeiten im Zusammenhang mit der täglichen Betriebsüberwachung.On top: Offene Menschen in der IT, die gern mit anderen reden. – Wir sind Schnittstelle zum Fachbereich. Heisst, wir müssen unser Know-how zielgruppengerecht verständlich runterbrechen können, um die Anforderungen zu besprechen.Was du ausserdem als Software Engineer mitbringen solltest:Hochschulabschluss in Informatik oder vergleichbaresLangjährige Erfahrung in der Mainframe Software-Entwicklung sowieFundierte Erfahrung im Betrieb von Mainframe-ApplikationenGute Deutsch-KenntnisseKontakte:Tatjana Janson (+41 58 285 9659), Nicole Rupp (+41 58 285 8511)Unterstütze uns: Software Engineer (w/m) Mainframe| 80% oder mehr - Jetzt bewerben!BerufserfahreneShow more

Anstatt eines Motivationsschreibens bitten wir Dich die Fragen im Bewerbungsprozess zu beantworten.Was wir erwartenDazu bringst du IT Kompetenzen aus beiden Welten - Software und DevOps Engineering - ein: Java 8 oder höher, Spring / SpringBoot, Apache Kafka, Docker, Kubernetes, Openshift, Jenkins, Groovy. Weil wir nah beim Kunden sind. So nah wie man das als IT'ler vielleicht von einem Versicherer nicht erwartet. Wir bekommen direktes Feedback und können unsere Software nutzergerecht optimieren. Du bekommst auch genug Challenge im Team . Pioniergeist und Schweizer Präzision! Als weltweit führender Hersteller von innovativen Optosensor-Lösungen mit Sitz im Osten der Schweiz, realisiert unser Mandant stetig neue Innovations-Projekte und setzt diesbezüglich weltweite Massstäbe. Dabei werden Produkte von der Idee bis zur Serienherstellung am Hauptsitz entwickelt, getestet und produziert. Unter anderem gilt die neuste Lösung im Bereich der Lift- und Aufzugssteuerung als Pionierleistung und revolutioniert die Aufzugspositionierung grundlegend. Im Auftrag des Mandanten suchen wir eine erfahrene und belastbare Persönlichkeit alsweb application software EngineerIHR VERANTWORTUNGSBEREICH Unser Mandant bietet Ihnen die einmalige Gelegenheit, in einem strategischen und geschäftskritischen Greenfield-Projekt mitzuwirken und mit Einsatz von modernsten Tools & Technologien sowie einem agilen Software Entwicklungsprozess, ein neues und Global eingesetztes ERP-System zu entwickeln und einzuführen. Im Zentrum steht die mittel bis langfristige Ablösung des bisherigen ERP-Systems durch die Inhouse entwickelte Nachfolgelösung. Direkt dem CEO unterstellt helfen Sie als Teammitglied des R&D Dienstleistungsteams mit, die Überführung aller relevanter Funktionalitäten mit einem guten Gespür für das Machbare bezüglich der logischen sowie technischen Abhängigkeiten durchzuführen. Im Rahmen der Software-Qualitätssicherung erstellen und entwickeln Sie die Dokumentationen, Spezifikationen sowie Software-Architektur etc. und sorgen für die Durchführung der automatisierten Tests sowie der Code-Reviews. In einer späteren Phase helfen Sie den reibungslosen Betrieb, das Release und Deployment Management sowie den Support des neuen ERP-Systems für alle internationalen Niederlassungen der Gruppe sicherzustellen. Als Poweruser sind Sie zudem Ansprechpartner für die ERP-System Stakeholder und stellen somit den Support und die Durchführung von Nutzerschulungen sicher.IHR PROFIL Sie bringen eine höhere Ausbildung in FH/ETH/UNI oder eine vergleichbare Erfahrung sowie mehrere Jahre als Praktiker in der Software- und Applikationsentwicklung im Umfeld von ins besonders OOP, HTML, CSS, JavaScript und Java mit. Idealerweise haben Sie auch Kenntnisse im Erstellen von webbasierten Applikationen im ERP Umfeld und der Anwendung von gängigen Cloud Technologien. Sie besitzen die Fähigkeit, sich autodidaktisch in neue Themen einzuarbeiten und diese in einem internationalen Umfeld einzusetzen. Im Laufe der Zeit haben Sie sich einen Sinn für praktikable und wirtschaftliche Infrastrukturen und Lösung im HW/SW Bereich angeeignet. Sie schätzen den Austausch in einer interdisziplinären Umgebung und sind daran interessiert, ihre Expertise für die gesamte Entwicklung, den Betrieb und den folgenden Support des neuen ERP-Systems einzubringen und das internationale Rollout bei allen Niederlassungen der Gruppe zu begleiten. Ihre sozialen Fähigkeiten helfen Ihnen im Kontakt mit den Stakeholdern, um einen proaktiven Austausch zu pflegen. Fliessende Deutsch und Englischkenntnisse runden Ihr Profil ab.IHRE PERSPEKTIVEN Dank dem internationalen Umfeld und den technologisch hochstehenden Produkten, werden Innovationen gefördert und auch honoriert. Dies widerspiegelt sich im offenen Austausch und dem ganzheitlichen Denken innerhalb der Unternehmung. Für die persönliche Entwicklung und Weiterbildung wie auch der Ausarbeitung weiterer Systemoptimierungen wird Ihnen gerne Zeit eingeräumt. Übergreifende Teamarbeit und die Mitarbeit bei Roadmap Definitionen gehören ebenfalls zu Ihren Perspektiven. Es erwartet Sie eine DU-Kultur, eine äusserst moderne Infrastruktur innerhalb des eigenen Science Park inklusive Restaurant sowie Starbucks-Corner und attraktive Anstellungsbedingungen bei einem der begehrtesten Arbeitgeber in der Region. Eine sehr flexible Home-Office Regelung runden das sehr attraktive Angebot ab.Show more

Learning days: At least once every quarter, we organise a shorter version of the learning week. A learning day focuses on one specific topic, and everyone is free to participate or not Learning weeks: We spend one week every year learning and growing together. Do you want a small snack? There’s always a wallet available in the office with some money in it. We're looking for talented, motivated Junior Software Engineer who can join us to help build the next generation access control systems. If you are a recent graduate, or want to move into Software Development from another field, and have an interest in building large-scale, high-performance, security-centric products and think end-to-end, this may be the job you've been looking for.

Our work is characterized by high scale, complexity and the need for invention. We offer great opportunities to work on access control, machine learning, IoT and high-scale, low-latency distributed systems.

Development opportunities:
As a recent/new graduate you will go through induction training. This is an hourly role where you will drive your own learning and development with guidance and coaching from your manager, buddy and colleagues around you - not to mention the excellent long-term development prospects you’d expect from one of the world’s leading online businesses.

Product Engineering- Build delightful full-stack user experiences that tackle real customer needs and help drive tons of revenue for Dropbox. As a product engineering intern you can expect to work across backend, API, desktop, mobile and web. Infrastructure Engineering- Craft the building blocks that let us scale Dropbox to handle millions of concurrent connections, hundreds of billions of files, and hundreds of petabytes of data. Analytics Engineering- Measure, optimize, and build one of the industry's most advanced analytics platforms to derive insights from vast amounts of data. Our massive scale means you'll work with more data than many other analytics firms combined. Mobile Engineering- Craft the Dropbox client experience on mobile devices by learning and applying the ins and outs of iOS and Android SDK using Kotlin and Swift. You are also responsible for building the backend systems that power the mobile experiences and optimize the protocol between client and server for reliability, efficiency and speed. Front End Engineering- Help keep our websites up and running by applying everything our application engineers do with the curiosity and interest in building fast, scalable, and responsive Dropbox experiences for the modern web, using technologies like Typescript, React, and Redux. Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)- Build the software and automation that controls the hardware to run our products. Work with a team who lives on the boundary of software and hardware and develop a deep understanding of the inner workings of our products, our commitment to ensuring our products work well on real-world hardware in our data centers, and serve as the first line of defense when something goes with our production infrastructure or services. Security Engineering- People trust Dropbox to keep their data secure, and at Dropbox we rely on our security engineers to make our products safe. You are a software engineer with a deep interest in building software that is secure yet easy to use. Security engineers collaborate with product teams to secure our software, production infrastructure, website, desktop and mobile apps and our corporate infrastructure and devices. 0-2 years of full-time software development experience Experience writing or shipping software as part of full-time work, college/bootcamp coursework, personal projects, internships, coding competitions or research Available to start in August - December 2021
 Passion for learning, solving problems, and challenging the status quo

company_offeredRole: Software Quality Assurance Engineer- PCB Design and Verification EDA
listing_jobDesc: We are looking for some to be responsible for the manual and automated design flow testing of a range of EDA Analysis/Simulation tools used within a High Speed PCB design flow. The individual will be working extensively with analog, mixed signal, signal integrity and EMC simulators and associated environments. Will be responsible for design, implementation, and execution of application specific functional/flow tests. Analyzing test results, defect tracking and metrics reporting. Will work closely with globally dispersed SW developers and will work with other QA team members to deliver on time quality releases through continuous improvement of the test and testing process. Practice Agile development methods and exemplify core Agile values of transparency, collaboration, acceptance of change, and iterative development Bachelor Degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science/Computer Engineering desired. Should have at least 4 years work experience in QA role in the EDA industry or related industry with a focus on flow testing between logical/physical PCB design tools and analysis tools. Should have a good working knowledge/programming experience with C++, shell scripts, Perl, Visual Basic, Java Script and Python. Working knowledge assumed for typical QA/Dev tools like defect tracking, memory checking, profilers, debuggers, source control. Working knowledge of Linux and Windows 7/8/10 required. Strong interpersonal and communication skills essential.

The position can be a work from home position or physically located in a Grinnell Mutual location with a work environment of a typical office setting; noise level is relatively quiet and occasional stress is encountered as deadlines approach. Our products comprise multiple services and those services are written in various languages (the best language for that particular task), but as a member of the Edge Stack team you’ll work primarily in Golang and Python. You’ll work on Linux or Mac: some of us work on one platform, some on the other, each choosing whichever platform makes us the most productive. You’ll also use your favorite IDE or editor; although we use different ones, we’re oddly free of those silly “mine is the best” discussions : ). You’ll work on our API gateway and ingress products on a distributed team building a feature, or reviewing open source community PRs, or improving performance, etc., in six-week development cycles, and then you’ll cool down between cycles doing self-directed learning, improving your tools, or maybe even hacking up a demo of an exciting new idea of yours. You and your team will use GitHub issues and ZenHub or Notion to track and plan the work, Markdown for documentation, CircleCI for continuous integration, Docker Hub for the resulting images, and of course Slack and Zoom. You’ll have a weekly all-company (Zoom) meeting to stay current on all the things, but we try hard to minimize the number of scheduled meetings in order to maximize focus time. You’ll work on Linux and Mac: some of us work on one platform, some on the other, but as a DevOps engineer you’ll need to ensure our tools work on both. You’ll also use your favorite IDE or editor; although we use different ones, we’re oddly free of those silly “mine is the best” discussions : ). You’ll work as part of an infrastructure team that’s proactively improving the security and reliability of our systems in six-week development cycles, and then you’ll cool down between cycles doing self-directed learning, improving your tools, or maybe even hacking up a demo of an exciting new idea of yours. You and your team will use GitHub issues and ZenHub or Notion to plan and track your the work; CircleCI for continuous integration; Amazon AWS, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure for cloud execution; Google Cloud for monitoring and alerts; Docker Hub, GCR, and Quay for container image hosting; Gatsby and Netlify for web site publication; and of course Slack and Zoom. You’ll have a weekly all-company (Zoom) meeting to stay current on all the things, but we try hard to minimize the number of scheduled meetings in order to maximize focus time. Our products comprise multiple services and those services are written in various languages (the best language for that particular task), but as a member of the Edge Stack team you’ll work primarily in Golang and Python. You’ll work on Linux or Mac: some of us work on one platform, some on the other, each choosing whichever platform makes us the most productive. You’ll also use your favorite IDE or editor; although we use different ones, we’re oddly free of those silly “mine is the best” discussions : ). You’ll work on our API gateway and ingress products on a distributed team building a feature, or reviewing open source community PRs, or improving performance, etc., in six-week development cycles, and then you’ll cool down between cycles doing self-directed learning, improving your tools, or maybe even hacking up a demo of an exciting new idea of yours. You and your team will use GitHub issues and ZenHub or Notion to track and plan the work, Markdown for documentation, CircleCI for continuous integration, Docker Hub for the resulting images, and of course Slack and Zoom. You’ll have a weekly all-company (Zoom) meeting to stay current on all the things, but we try hard to minimize the number of scheduled meetings in order to maximize focus time. Did you know that each year, the average person uses about 200 products? That's 200 choices you're making about what you put in your body, in your children's bodies, and in the environment. Join us in our mission to help more people make the switch to healthy and sustainable products. Huge opportunity for career growth — you join Social Nature to build a career, not just do a job. As a small team, we value input across the business and look for eagerness to learn and grow. Your opinions count, your ideas can be actioned quickly, and you're a key player in our success. We create personalized growth & development plans for each employee and revisit them twice a year. And this year, we were proud to be recognized as one of the top 6 high-performance index cultures by SupportingLines. Grow with us! Time to take care of yourself — 15 days vacation, along with 3 personal days, and a winter holiday flex week between Dec 24 - Dec 31 (80% R&R/20% Work) Competitive benefits — generous employee stock options so you can benefit from our growth, extended health/dental/vision benefits, a confidential Employee Assistance Program (EAP) and a $1,000 annual wellness spending account (gym pass, running shoes, bike etc.) Flexible work environment — slot in as much face-to-face time with your team as you can in our beautiful downtown Vancouver office, but sometimes you do your best work in slippers. Throughout COVID-19 we've encouraged people to work from home and have given everyone a one-time $500 stipend to set up their home office. *We are open to applicants from across British Columbia, Canada for this role. Team events — we believe that a team that plays together stays together. Throughout COVID-19 we've had to get more creative with our team events hosting virtual social hours, 30-day health & sustainability challenges, online trivia/ board games events, and even Zoom cooking challenges. And each year we host a wellness retreat that's focused on your personal development and growth. Development environment freedom — we are fully cross-platform and embrace open-source. Choose your weapon – are you a PC or a Mac?

company_offeredRole: Senior Engineer - Process Control - Logan Lake
listing_jobDesc: Be a Courageous Safety Leader by adhering to safety and environmental rules and procedures, leading Safety Investigations, participating in Visible Felt Leadership and Safety Tours; Work with the Mill Operations, Maintenance and other support groups to provide technical support for the design and implementation of control strategies and real-time optimization for the selected operational circuits at Teck Highland Valley Copper Partnership (HVC); Work with other technical personnel within Teck to support the expansion of Process Control within the organization; Provide effective support and process engineering services to the Mill Operations group by analyzing processes and equipment, recommending improved methods, optimization opportunities and reviewing key targets and actions; Develop, implement and maintain online process monitoring applications. Conduct daily monitoring and troubleshooting of existing regulatory and advanced control strategies; Configure hardware/software infrastructure for regulatory and advanced applications development and implementation; Identification, planning and execution of technical development projects; Draft and issue authoritative technical reports on process development projects; Draft capital Appropriation Requests (ARs) and Project Charters for projects predicted to advance targets for metal recovery, concentrate grade quality, reduced risk of injury/hazard or reduced cost of production; Manage the work and safety compliance of outside suppliers and consulting personnel for the duration of specific projects while they are on the HVC site. Electrical, Metallurgical or Chemical engineer degree with MSc. in process control; Minimum of 7 years of relevant hands-on experience maintaining, troubleshooting, designing and implementing real-time optimization strategies in mineral processing (e.g. Crushing, Grinding, Flotation, Dewatering); Experience with instrumentation, PLC/DCS, HMI, historian, communications (e.g. OPC); Experience reviewing and developing PFDs, P&IDs and HAZOPs; Experience in process identification, modelling and simulation (e.g. Matlab); Experience in data science techniques to find data patterns, anomalies and optimization opportunities; Experience in proven basic control (actuators, sensors, regulatory control, loop tuning, etc.); Experience in advanced process control (e.g. advanced regulatory control, fuzzy, MPC, Expert, etc.); Knowledge of data exploration, preparation and machine learning modelling; Testing and commissioning work experience; Ability to document work, interpret, translate and communicate analytical findings using effective relevant visualizations; Self-motivated teammate with the ability to mentor and coach co-workers; Must be eligible for Professional Engineer membership in the Association of Professional Engineers and Geoscientists of the Province of British Columbia; Must have a valid driver’s license (BC 7N or equivalent).

listing_jobDesc: Als Softwaretester bist Du für die Durchführung von manuellen und automatisierten Tests sowie für die Implementierung von automatisierten Tests für unsere webbasierten IoT-Produkte verantwortlich. Du verfügst über Erfahrungen mit Frameworks zum automatischen Softwaretest wie Robot Framework, Selenium oder Sahi. Du hast bereits Erfahrung in der Softwareentwicklung gesammelt und kannst mit Java, JavaScript, Phyton sowie GIT umgehen. Idealerweise hast Du Erfahrung mit Cloud-gehosteten Microservices und Kenntnisse von SQL-Datenbanken. Sehr gute Kenntnisse der deutschen und englischen Sprache runden dein Profil ab. Hightechliebe mit kompromisslos anspruchsvoller Technik Freiraum für Gestaltungshunger und Deine ganz persönliche Erfolgsgeschichte Menschlichkeit, die von Herzen kommt: mit Offenheit, Beteiligung und Raum für Leben und Familie Das gute Gefühl von Sicherheit: zum Ankommen und Bleiben Erfahre mehr von unseren Benefits auf unserer Karriereseite
